scene v

enter king france dauphin duke bourbon
constable france others

french king
tis certain hath pass river somme

constable
fought withal lord
let us live france let us quit
give vineyards barbarous people

dauphin
dieu vivant shall sprays us
emptying fathers luxury
scions put wild savage stock
spirt suddenly clouds
overlook grafters

bourbon
normans bastard normans norman bastards
mort de vie march along
unfought withal sell dukedom
buy slobbery dirty farm
nook shotten isle albion

constable
dieu de batailles mettle
climate foggy raw dull
despite sun looks pale
killing fruit frowns sodden water
drench sur rein jades barley broth
decoct cold blood valiant heat
shall quick blood spirited wine
seem frosty honour land
let us hang like roping icicles
upon houses thatch whiles frosty people
sweat drops gallant youth rich fields
poor may call native lords

dauphin
faith honour
madams mock us plainly say
mettle bred give
bodies lust english youth
new store france bastard warriors

bourbon
bid us english dancing schools
teach lavoltas high swift corantos
saying grace heels
lofty runaways

french king
montjoy herald speed hence
let greet england sharp defiance
princes spirit honour edged
sharper swords hie field
charles delabreth high constable france
dukes orleans bourbon berry
alenon brabant bar burgundy
jacques chatillon rambures vaudemont
beaumont grandpr roussi fauconbridge
foix lestrale boucicault charolois
high dukes great princes barons lords knights
great seats quit great shames
bar harry england sweeps land
pennons painted blood harfleur
rush host doth melted snow
upon valleys whose low vassal seat
alps doth spit void rheum upon
go upon power enough
captive chariot rouen
bring prisoner

constable
becomes great
sorry numbers
soldiers sick famish march
sure shall see army
drop heart sink fear
achievement offer us ransom

french king
therefore lord constable haste montjoy
let say england send
know willing ransom give
prince dauphin shall stay us rouen

dauphin
beseech majesty

french king
patient shall remain us
forth lord constable princes
quickly bring us word england fall

act iv

enter chorus

chorus
entertain conjecture time
creeping murmur poring dark
fills wide vessel universe
camp camp foul womb night
hum either army stilly sounds
fix sentinels almost receive
secret whispers watch
fire answers fire paly flames
battle sees umber face
steed threatens steed high boastful neighs
piercing night dull ear tents
armourers accomplishing knights
busy hammers closing rivets
give dreadful note preparation
country cocks crow clocks toll
third hour drowsy morning name
proud numbers secure soul
confident lusty french
low rated english play dice
chide cripple tardy gaited night
like foul ugly witch doth limp
tediously away poor condemned english
like sacrifices watchful fires
sit patiently inly ruminate
morning danger gesture sad
investing lank lean cheeks war worn coats
presented unto gazing moon
many horrid ghosts behold
royal captain ruin band
walking watch watch tent tent
let cry praise glory head
forth goes visits host
bids good morrow modest smile
calls brothers friends countrymen
upon royal face note
dread army hath enrounded
doth dedicate one jot colour
unto weary watched night
freshly looks bears attaint
cheerful semblance sweet majesty
every wretch pining pale
beholding plucks comfort looks
largess universal like sun
liberal eye doth give everyone
thawing cold fear mean gentle
behold may unworthiness define
little touch harry night
scene must battle fly
pity shall much disgrace
four five vile ragged foils
right ill dispos brawl ridiculous
name agincourt yet sit see
minding true things mock ries

exit

greater therefore courage

besides outward consciences
preachers us admonishing
dress us fairly end
thus may gather honey weed
make moral devil

upon king let us lives souls

twin born greatness subject breath

must kings neglect private men enjoy
kings privates

art thou thou idol ceremony
kind god art thou suffer st
mortal griefs thy worshippers
thy rents thy comings

thy soul adoration
art thou aught else place degree form

fearing

poison flattery sick great greatness
bid thy ceremony give thee cure

command health thou proud dream
play st subtly king repose
king find thee know
tis balm sceptre ball

intertissued robe gold pearl
farced title running fore king
throne sits tide pomp
beats upon high shore world
thrice gorgeous ceremony
laid bed majestical
sleep soundly wretched slave
body fill vacant mind

never sees horrid night child hell
like lackey rise set
sweats eye phoebus night

doth rise help hyperion horse

profitable labour grave

whose hours peasant best advantages

act v

enter chorus

chorus
vouchsafe read story
may prompt
humbly pray admit excuse
time numbers due course things
huge proper life
presented bear king
toward calais grant seen
heave away upon winged thoughts
athwart sea behold english beach
pales flood men wives boys
whose shouts claps voice deep mouth sea
like mighty whiffler fore king
seems prepare way let land
solemnly see set london
swift pace hath thought even
may imagine upon blackheath
lords desire borne
bruised helmet bended sword
city forbids
free vainness self glorious pride
giving full trophy signal ostent
quite god behold
quick forge working house thought
london doth pour citizens
mayor brethren best sort
like senators th antique rome
plebeians swarming heels
go forth fetch conquering caesar
lower loving likelihood
general gracious empress
good time may ireland coming
bringing rebellion broached sword
many would peaceful city quit
welcome much much cause
harry london place
yet lamentation french
invites king england stay home
emperor coming behalf france
order peace omit
occurrences whatever chanc
till harry back return france
must bring play
interim rememb ring tis past
brook abridgement eyes advance
thoughts straight back france

scene ii france royal palace

enter one door king henry exeter bedford warwick gloucester

duty equal love
great kings france england labour
wits pains strong endeavours
bring imperial majesties
unto bar royal interview
mightiness parts best witness
since office hath far prevail
face face royal eye eye
congreeted let disgrace
demand royal view
rub impediment
naked poor mangled peace
dear nurse arts plenties joyful births
best garden world
fertile france put lovely visage
alas hath france long chas
husbandry doth lie heaps
corrupting fertility
vine merry cheerer heart
unpruned dies hedges even pleach
like prisoners wildly overgrown hair
put forth disorder twigs fallow leas
darnel hemlock rank fumitory
doth root upon coulter rusts
deracinate savagery
even mead erst brought sweetly forth
freckled cowslip burnet green clover
wanting scythe uncorrected rank
conceives idleness nothing teems
hateful docks rough thistles kecksies burs
losing beauty utility
vineyards fallows meads hedges
defective natures grow wildness
even houses children
lost learn want time
sciences become country
grow like savages soldiers
nothing meditate blood
swearing stern looks diffus attire
everything seems unnatural
reduce former favour
assembled speech entreats
may know let gentle peace
expel inconveniences
bless us former qualities

king henry

whose want gives growth imperfections
cited must buy peace
full accord demands
whose tenours particular effects
enschedul briefly hands

urg lies answer

never break urging thou canst love fellow temper

say thee shall die true thy love

fellow plain uncoined constancy perforce must thee
right hath gift woo places

favours always reason speaker

heart kate sun moon rather sun

epilogue

enter chorus

chorus
thus far rough unable pen
bending author hath pursu story
little room confining mighty men
mangling starts full course glory
small time small greatly lived
star england fortune made sword
world best garden achieved
left son imperial lord
henry sixth infant bands crown king
france england king succeed
whose state many managing
lost france made england bleed
oft stage hath shown sake
fair minds let acceptance take

exit




first part henry sixth

dramatis personae

duke bedford uncle king regent france

afterwards cardinal

afterwards duke york

sir william glansdale

lawyer
gaolers mortimer

reignier duke anjou titular king naples

tower london

enter mortimer brought chair gaolers

scene england

add measure woes
come tell things sith befall n

london keeper king
muster soldiers gathered flocks friends
well appointed thought
march toward saint albans intercept queen

touching king henry oath succession
short tale make saint albans met
battles join sides fiercely fought
whether coldness king

robb soldiers heated spleen
whether report success
common fear clifford rigour

enter warwick

scene ii field battle near barnet

prologue

come make laugh things
bear weighty serious brow
sad high working full state woe
noble scenes draw eye flow
present pity
may think well let fall tear
subject deserve give
money hope may believe
may find truth come see
show two agree
play may pass still willing
undertake may see away shilling
richly two short hours
come hear merry bawdy play
noise targets see fellow
long motley coat guarded yellow
deceiv gentle hearers know
rank chosen truth show
fool fight beside forfeiting
brains opinion bring
make true intend
leave us never understanding friend
therefore goodness sake known
first happiest hearers town
sad would make ye think ye see
persons noble story
living think see great
follow general throng sweat
thousand friends moment see
soon mightiness meets misery
merry say
man may weep upon wedding day

salisbury like tender love make
rest without spot evermore
prince henry kind soul would give thanks
knows tears
bastard let us pay time needful woe
since hath beforehand griefs
england never never shall
lie proud foot conqueror
first help wound
princes come home
come three corners world arms
shall shock nought shall make us rue
england rest true exeunt




tragedy julius caesar

open perils surest answered

scene ii brutus tent camp near sardis

shall satisfied

familiar instances
free friendly conference
hath us old

brutus
thou hast describ
hot friend cooling ever note lucilius
love begins sicken decay
useth enforced ceremony
tricks plain simple faith
hollow men like horses hot hand
make gallant show promise mettle

low march within

endure bloody spur
fall crests like deceitful jades
sink trial comes army

lucilius
meant night sardis quarter

means

edmund
persuade murder lordship
told revenging gods
gainst parricides thunders bend
spoke manifold strong bond
child bound father sir fine
seeing loathly opposite stood
unnatural purpose fell motion
prepared sword charges home
unprovided body latch mine arm
saw best alarum spirits
bold quarrel right rous th encounter
whether gasted noise made
full suddenly fled

gloucester

land shall remain uncaught
found dispatch noble duke master
worthy arch patron comes tonight
authority proclaim
finds shall deserve thanks
bringing murderous coward stake
conceals death

edmund
dissuaded intent
found pight curst speech
threaten discover replied
thou unpossessing bastard dost thou think
would stand thee would reposal
trust virtue worth thee
make thy words faith deny
would ay though thou didst produce
character turn
thy suggestion plot damned practice
thou must make dullard world
thought profits death
pregnant potential spurs
make thee seek

gloucester
strange fast ned villain
would deny letter said never got

tucket within

hark duke trumpets know comes
ports bar villain shall scape
duke must grant besides picture
send far near kingdom
may due note land
loyal natural boy work means
make thee capable

wherein must use advice
father hath writ hath sister
differences best thought fit

hence attend dispatch good old friend

act ii scene ii park

enter princess france three attending ladies
rosaline maria katharine boyet two lords

boyet madam summon dearest spirits
consider king father sends
sends embassy
held precious world esteem
parley sole inheritor
perfections man may owe
matchless navarre plea less weight
aquitaine dowry queen
prodigal dear grace
nature making graces dear
starve general world beside
prodigally gave
princess france good lord boyet beauty though mean
needs painted flourish praise
beauty bought judgment eye

exit servant

dagger see
handle toward hand come let clutch thee
thee yet see thee still
art thou fatal vision sensible
feeling sight art thou
dagger mind false creation
proceeding heat oppressed brain
see thee yet form palpable
draw
thou marshall st way going
instrument use
mine eyes made fools senses
else worth rest see thee still
thy blade dudgeon gouts blood
thing
bloody business informs
thus mine eyes er one half world
nature seems dead wicked dreams abuse
curtain sleep witchcraft celebrates
pale hecate rings wither murder
alarum sentinel wolf

act iii scene prison

enter duke disguised claudio provost

duke hope pardon lord angelo
claudio miserable medicine
hope
hope eve prepar die
duke absolute death either death life
shall thereby sweeter reason thus life
lose thee lose thing
none fools would keep breath thou art
servile skyey influences
dost habitation thou keep st
hourly afflict merely thou art death fool
thou labour st thy flight shun
yet run st toward still thou art noble
th accommodations thou bear st
nurs baseness thou rt means valiant
thou dost fear soft tender fork
poor worm thy best rest sleep
thou oft provok st yet grossly fear st
thy death thou art thyself
thou exists many thousand grains
issue dust happy thou art
thou hast still thou striv st get
thou hast forget st thou art certain
thy complexion shifts strange effects
moon thou art rich thou rt poor
like ass whose back ingots bows
thou bear st thy heavy riches journey
death unloads thee friend hast thou none
thine bowels call thee sire
mere effusion thy proper loins
curse gout serpigo rheum
ending thee sooner thou hast youth age
dinner sleep
dreaming thy blessed youth
becomes aged doth beg alms
palsied eld thou art old rich
thou hast neither heat affection limb beauty
make thy riches pleasant yet
bears name life yet life
lie hid moe thousand deaths yet death fear
makes odds even
claudio humbly thank
sue live find seek die
seeking death find life let come
isabella within ho peace grace good company
provost come wish deserves welcome
duke dear sir ere long visit
claudio holy sir thank

act ii

scene belmont room portia house

flourish cornets enter prince morocco tawny moor
white three four followers accordingly portia nerissa
train

prince morocco
mislike complexion
shadowed livery burnish sun
neighbour near bred
bring fairest creature northward born
phbus fire scarce thaws icicles
let us make incision love
prove whose blood reddest mine
tell thee lady aspect mine
hath fear valiant love swear
best regarded virgins clime
lov would change hue
except steal thoughts gentle queen

portia
terms choice solely led
nice direction maiden eyes
besides lott ry destiny
bars right voluntary choosing

house troubled rat

ban answer yet

abide gaping pig

exit stephano

sweet moonlight sleeps upon bank
sit let sounds music
creep ears soft stillness night
become touches sweet harmony
sit jessica look floor heaven
thick inlaid patens bright gold
smallest orb thou behold st
motion like angel sings
still quiring young eyed cherubins
harmony immortal souls
whilst muddy vesture decay
doth grossly close hear

enter musicians

come ho wake diana hymn
sweetest touches pierce mistress ear
draw home music

music

jessica
never merry hear sweet music

lorenzo
reason spirits attentive
note wild wanton herd
race youthful unhandled colts
fetching mad bounds bellowing neighing loud
hot condition blood
hear perchance trumpet sound
air music touch ears
shall perceive make mutual stand
savage eyes turn modest gaze
sweet power music therefore poet
feign orpheus drew trees stones floods
since naught stockish hard full rage
music time doth change nature
man hath music
mov concord sweet sounds
fit treasons stratagems spoils
motions spirit dull night
affections dark erebus
let man trusted mark music

enter portia nerissa

portia

far little candle throws beams
shines good deed naughty world

portia

substitute shines brightly king
king state

main waters music hark

methinks sounds much sweeter day

nerissa
silence bestows virtue madam

portia

neither attended think
nightingale sing day
every goose cackling would thought
better musician wren

act

scene athens room palace theseus

enter theseus hippolyta philostrate attendants

theseus
fair hippolyta nuptial hour
draws apace four happy days bring
another moon oh methinks slow
old moon wanes lingers desires
like step dame dowager
long withering young man revenue

hippolyta
four days quickly steep night
four nights quickly dream away time
moon like silver bow
new bent heaven shall behold night
solemnities

turn melancholy forth funerals
pale companion pomp

thy love thee injuries
wed thee another key
pomp triumph revelling

full vexation come complaint
child daughter hermia

man hath consent marry
stand forth lysander gracious duke
man hath bewitch bosom child
thou thou lysander thou hast given rhymes
interchang love tokens child
thou hast moonlight window sung
feigning voice verses feigning love
stol n impression fantasy
bracelets thy hair rings gauds conceits
knacks trifles nosegays sweetmeats messengers
strong prevailment unharden youth
cunning hast thou filch daughter heart
turn obedience due
stubborn harshness gracious duke
grace
consent marry demetrius
beg ancient privilege athens
mine may dispose
shall either gentleman
death according law
immediately provided case

theseus
say hermia advis fair maid
father god
one compos beauties yea one
form wax
imprinted within power
leave figure disfigure

lysander

must held worthier

act ii

scene wood near athens

enter fairy one door puck another

puck
spirit whither wander

fairy
hill dale
thorough bush thorough brier
park pale
thorough flood thorough fire
wander everywhere
swifter moon sphere
serve fairy queen

cowslips tall pensioners
gold coats spots see
rubies fairy favours
freckles live savours
must go seek dew drops
hang pearl every cowslip ear

queen elves come anon

take heed queen come within sight
oberon passing fell wrath
attendant hath
lovely boy stol n indian king
never sweet changeling
jealous oberon would child
knight train trace forests wild
perforce withholds lovd boy
crowns flowers makes joy
never meet grove green
fountain clear spangled starlight sheen
square elves fear
creep acorn cups hide

else shrewd knavish sprite

work shall good luck

whole quire hold hips loffe

room fairy comes oberon

mistress would gone

make fair aegles break faith
ariadne antiopa

forgeries jealousy
never since middle summer spring
met hill dale forest mead
pavd fountain rushy brook
beachd margent sea

thy brawls thou hast disturb sport
therefore winds piping us vain
revenge suck sea
contagious fogs falling land
hath every pelting river made proud
overborne continents
ox hath therefore stretch yoke vain
ploughman lost sweat green corn
hath rotted ere youth attain beard
fold stands empty drownd field
crows fatted murrion flock
nine men morris fill mud
quaint mazes wanton green
lack tread undistinguishable
human mortals want winter
night hymn carol blest
therefore moon governess floods
pale anger washes air
rheumatic diseases abound
thorough distemperature see
seasons alter hoary headed frosts
fall fresh lap crimson rose
old hiems thin icy crown
odorous chaplet sweet summer buds
mockery set spring summer
childing autumn angry winter change
wonted liveries mazed world
increase knows
progeny evils comes
debate dissension
parents original

amend lies
titania cross oberon
beg little changeling boy
henchman

scene ii another part wood

enter oberon

must dote extremity

puck
mistress monster love
near close consecrated bower
dull sleeping hour
crew patches rude mechanicals
work bread upon athenian stalls
met together rehearse play
intended great theseus nuptial day
shallowest thick skin barren sort
pyramus presented sport
forsook scene enter brake
advantage take
ass nole fixed head
anon thisbe must answerd
forth mimic comes spy
wild geese creeping fowler eye
russet pated choughs many sort
rising cawing gun report
sever madly sweep sky
sight away fellows fly
stamp er er one falls
murder cries help athens calls
sense thus weak lost fears thus strong
made senseless things begin wrong
briers thorns apparel snatch

enter puck

puck
hungry lion roars
wolf behowls moon
whilst heavy ploughman snores
weary task fordone
wasted brands glow
whilst screech owl screeching loud
puts wretch lies woe
remembrance shroud
time night
graves gaping wide
every one lets forth sprite
church way paths glide
fairies run
triple hecate team
presence sun
following darkness like dream
frolic mouse
shall disturb hallow house
sent broom
sweep dust behind door

enter oberon titania train

dead drowsy fire

sing bless place

song dance

break day

issue create

meet break day

exeunt oberon titania train

puck
shadows offended
think mended
slumber
visions appear
weak idle theme
yielding dream
gentles reprehend
pardon mend
honest puck
unearnd luck
scape serpent tongue
make amends ere long
else puck liar call
good night unto
give hands friends
robin shall restore amends

exit

much wonder one man seeing much another man

act iii

scene leonato garden

enter hero margaret ursula


hero
good margaret run thee parlour
shalt thou find cousin beatrice
proposing prince claudio
whisper ear tell ursala
walk orchard whole discourse
say thou overheard st us
bid steal pleached bower
honey suckles ripen sun
forbid sun enter like favourites
made proud princes advance pride
power bred hide
listen propose thy office
bear thee well leave us alone


margaret
make come warrant presently


exit


hero
ursula beatrice doth come
trace alley
talk must benedick
name let thy part
praise ever man merit
talk thee must benedick
sick love beatrice matter
little cupid crafty arrow made
wounds hearsay


enter beatrice behind


begin
look beatrice like lapwing runs
close ground hear conference


ursula
pleasant st angling see fish
cut golden oars silver stream
greedily devour treacherous bait
angle beatrice even
couched woodbine coverture
fear part dialogue


hero
go near ear lose nothing
false sweet bait lay


advance bower


truly ursula disdainful
know spirits coy wild
haggards rock


ursula
sure
benedick loves beatrice entirely


hero
says prince new trothed lord


ursula
bid tell madam


hero
entreat acquaint
persuaded lov benedick
wish wrestle affection
never let beatrice know


ursula
doth gentleman
deserve full fortunate bed
ever beatrice shall couch upon


hero
god love know doth deserve
much may yielded man
nature never fram woman heart
prouder stuff beatrice
disdain scorn ride sparkling eyes
misprising look wit
values highly
matter else seems weak love
take shape project affection
self endear


ursula
sure think
therefore certainly good
knew love lest make sport


hero
speak truth never yet saw man
wise noble young rarely featur
would spell backward fair fac
would swear gentleman sister
black nature drawing antick
made foul blot tall lance ill headed
low agate vilely cut
speaking vane blown winds
silent block moved none
turns every man wrong side
never gives truth virtue
simpleness merit purchaseth


ursula
sure sure carping commendable


hero
odd fashions
beatrice commendable
dare tell speak
would mock air would laugh
press death wit
therefore let benedick like cover fire
consume away sighs waste inwardly
better death die mocks
bad die tickling


ursula
yet tell hear say


hero
rather go benedick
counsel fight passion
truly devise honest slanders
stain cousin one doth know
much ill word may empoison liking


ursula
cousin wrong
much without true judgment
swift excellent wit
priz refuse
rare gentleman signior benedick


hero
man italy
always excepted dear claudio


ursula
pray angry madam
speaking fancy signior benedick
shape bearing argument valour
goes foremost report italy


hero
indeed hath excellent good name


ursula
excellence earn ere
married madam


hero
every day tomorrow come go
show thee attires thy counsel
best furnish tomorrow


ursula
lim warrant
caught madam


hero
prove loving goes haps
cupid kills arrows traps


exeunt hero ursula


beatrice
advancing fire mine ears true
stand condemn pride scorn much
contempt farewell maiden pride adieu
glory lives behind back
benedick love requite thee
taming wild heart thy loving hand
thou dost love kindness shall incite thee
bind loves holy band
others say thou dost deserve
believe better reportingly


exit

act iv

scene inside church

enter pedro john leonato friar francis claudio
benedick hero beatrice c


leonato
come friar francis brief plain form
marriage shall recount particular duties
afterwards


friar
come hither lord marry lady


claudio



leonato
married friar come marry


friar
lady come hither married count


hero



friar
either know inward impediment
conjoined charge souls utter


claudio
know hero


hero
none lord


friar
know count


leonato
dare make answer none


claudio
men dare men may men daily
knowing


benedick
interjections laughing ah ha



claudio
stand thee friar father leave
free unconstrained soul
give maid daughter


leonato
freely son god give


claudio
give back whose worth
may counterpoise rich precious gift


pedro
nothing unless render


claudio
sweet prince learn noble thankfulness
leonato take back
give rotten orange friend
sign semblance honour
behold like maid blushes
authority show truth
cunning sin cover withal
comes blood modest evidence
witness simple virtue would swear
see maid
exterior shows none
knows heat luxurious bed
blush guiltiness modesty


leonato
mean lord


claudio
married
knit soul approved wanton


leonato
dear lord proof
vanquish resistance youth
made defeat virginity


claudio
know would say known
say embrace husband
extenuate forehand sin leonato
never tempted word large
brother sister show
bashful sincerity comely love


hero
seem ever otherwise


claudio
thee seeming write
seem dian orb
chaste bud ere blown

bring father lov child
whose joy overwhelm like mine
bid speak patience

pericles

scene ii tyre room palace

enter pericles lords

pericles
lords without let none disturb us change
thoughts
sad companion dull eyed melancholy
used guest hour
day glorious walk peaceful night
tomb grief sleep breed quiet
pleasures court mine eyes mine eyes shun
danger fear antioch
whose arm seems far short hit
yet neither pleasure art joy spirits
yet distance comfort
thus passions mind
first conception misdread
nourishment life care
first fear might done
grows elder cares done
great antiochus
gainst little contend
since great make act
think speaking though swear silence
boots say honour
suspect may dishonour
may make blush known
stop course might known
hostile forces erspread land
ostent war look huge
amazement shall drive courage state
men vanquish ere resist
subjects punish ne er thought offence
care pity
tops trees
fence roots grow defend
makes body pine soul languish
punish would punish

enter helicanus lords

first lord
joy comfort sacred breast

second lord
keep mind till return us
peaceful comfortable

helicanus
peace peace give experience tongue
abuse king flatter
flattery bellows blows sin
thing flatter spark
spark gives heat stronger glowing
whereas reproof obedient order
fits kings men may err
signior sooth proclaim peace
flatters makes war upon life
prince pardon strike please
much lower knees

pericles
leave us else let cares erlook
shipping lading
return us

exeunt lords

helicanus thou
hast moved us seest thou looks

helicanus
angry brow dread lord

pericles
dart princes frowns
durst thy tongue move anger face

nourishment

pericles
thou know st power
take thy life thee

helicanus kneeling
ground axe
strike blow

pericles
rise prithee rise
sit thou art flatterer
thank thee heaven forbid
kings let ears hear faults hid
fit counsellor servant prince
thy wisdom makest prince thy servant
wouldst thou

helicanus
bear patience
griefs lay upon

pericles
thou speak st like physician helicanus
ministers potion unto
thou wouldst tremble receive thyself
attend went antioch
thou know st face death
sought purchase glorious beauty
whence issue might propagate
arms princes bring joys subjects
face mine eye beyond wonder
rest hark thine ear black incest
knowledge found sinful father
seem strike smooth thou know st
tis time fear tyrants seems kiss
fear grew hither fled
covering careful night
seem good protector
bethought past might succeed
knew tyrannous tyrants fears
decrease grow faster years
doubt doubt doth
open listening air
many worthy princes bloods shed
keep bed blackness unlaid ope
lop doubt fill land arms
make pretence wrong done
mine may call offence
must feel war blow spares innocence
love thyself art one
reprovest

helicanus
alas sir

pericles
drew sleep mine eyes blood cheeks
musings mind thousand doubts
might stop tempest ere came
finding little comfort relieve
thought princely charity grieve

helicanus
well lord since given leave speak
freely speak antiochus fear
justly think fear tyrant
either public war private treason
take away life
therefore lord go travel
till rage anger forgot
till destinies cut thread life
rule direct
day serves light faithful

pericles
doubt thy faith
wrong liberties absence

helcanus
mingle bloods together earth
whence birth

pericles
tyre look thee tarsus
intend travel hear thee
whose letters dispose
care subjects good
thee lay whose wisdom strength bear
take thy word faith ask thine oath
shuns break one sure crack
orbs live round safe
time truth shall ne er convince
thou show dst subject shine true prince

exeunt



scene iii tyre ante chamber palace

enter thaliard

thaliard
tyre court must kill king pericles
sure hanged home tis dangerous
well perceive wise fellow good discretion
bid ask would king desired might know none
secrets see reason king
bid man villain bound indenture oath
one husht come lords tyre

enter helicanus escanes lords tyre

helicanus

doth speak sufficiently gone travel

would depart give light unto
antioch

helicanus

doubting lest err sinn
show sorrow correct
puts unto shipman toil
minute threatens life death

shall hang although would
since gone king seas must please
scaped land perish sea
present peace lords tyre

lord thaliard antiochus welcome

thaliard
come
message unto princely pericles

friends antioch may feast tyre

scene iv tarsus room governor house

enter cleon governor tarsus dionyza others

cleon
dionyza shall rest us
relating tales others griefs
see twill teach us forget

dionyza
blow fire hope quench
digs hills aspire
throws one mountain cast higher
distressed lord even griefs
felt seen mischief eyes
like groves topp higher rise

cleon
dionyza
wanteth food say wants
conceal hunger till famish
tongues sorrows sound deep
woes air eyes weep
till tongues fetch breath may proclaim louder
heaven slumber creatures want
may awake helps comfort
discourse woes felt several years
wanting breath speak help tears

dionyza
best sir

cleon
tarsus er government
city plenty held full hand
riches strew even streets
whose towers bore heads high kiss clouds
strangers ne er beheld wonder
whose men dames jetted adorn
like one another glass trim
tables stored full glad sight
much feed delight
poverty scorn pride great
name help grew odious repeat

dionyza
tis true

cleon
see heaven change
mouths late earth sea air
little content please
although gave creatures abundance
houses defiled want use
starved want exercise
palates yet two summers younger
must inventions delight taste
would glad bread beg
mothers nousle babes
thought nought curious ready
eat little darlings loved
sharp hunger teeth man wife
draw lots first shall die lengthen life
stands lord lady weeping
many sink yet see fall
scarce strength left give burial
true

dionyza
cheeks hollow eyes witness

cleon
let cities plenty cup
prosperities largely taste
superflous riots hear tears
misery tarsus may

enter lord

lord
lord governor

cleon

speak thy sorrows thou bring st haste
comfort far us expect

lord
descried upon neighbouring shore
portly sail ships make hitherward

cleon
thought much
one sorrow never comes brings heir
may succeed inheritor
neighbouring nation
taking advantage misery
stuff hollow vessels power
beat us already
make conquest unhappy
whereas glory got overcome

lord
least fear semblance
white flags display bring us peace
come us favourers foes

cleon
thou speak st like untutor repeat
makes fairest show means deceit
bring
need fear
ground lowest half way
go tell general attend
know comes whence comes
craves

lord
go lord

exit

cleon
welcome peace peace consist
wars unable resist

enter pericles attendants

pericles
lord governor hear
let ships number men
like beacon fired amaze eyes

seen desolation streets
come add sorrow tears

ships happily may think
like trojan horse stuff within
bloody veins expecting overthrow
stored corn make needy bread
give life hunger starved half dead

pray

harbourage ourself ships men

wives children

scene iv tyre room governor house

enter helicanus escanes

helicanus
escanes know
antiochus incest lived free
high gods minding longer
withhold vengeance store
due heinous capital offence
even height pride glory
seated chariot
inestimable value daughter
fire heaven came shrivell
bodies even loathing stunk
eyes adored ere fall
scorn hand give burial

twas strange

greatness guard bar heaven shaft
sin reward

tis true

first lord

prince live let us salute
know ground made happy breath
world live seek
grave rest find
resolved lives govern us
dead give cause mourn funeral
leave us free election

second lord
whose death indeed strongest censure
knowing kingdom without head
like goodly buildings left without roof
soon fall ruin noble self
best know rule reign
thus submit unto sovereign


live noble helicane

helicanus
honour cause forbear suffrages
love prince pericles forbear
take wish leap seas
hourly trouble minute ease
twelvemonth longer let entreat
forbear absence king
time expired return
shall aged patience bear yoke
win love
go search like nobles like noble subjects
search spend adventurous worth
find win unto return
shall like diamonds sit crown

first lord
wisdom fool yield
since lord helicane enjoineth us
travels endeavour us

helicanus
love us clasp hands
peers thus knit kingdom ever stands

exeunt

act iii

enter gower

gower
sleep yslaked hath rouse
din snores house
made louder erfed breast
pompous marriage feast
cat eyne burning coal
couches fore mouse hole
crickets sing oven mouth
blither drouth

loss maidenhead
babe moulded attent
time briefly spent
fine fancies quaintly eche
dumb show plain speech

dumb show enter pericles simonides one door attendants
messenger meets kneels gives pericles letter pericles
shows simonides lords kneel enter thaisa

rejoices pericles take leave father depart
lychorida attendants exeunt simonides rest

many dern painful perch
pericles careful search
four opposing coigns
world together joins
made due diligence
horse sail high expense
stead quest last tyre
fame answering strange enquire
th court king simonides
letters brought tenour
antiochus daughter dead
men tyrus head
helicanus would set
crown tyre none
mutiny hastes oppress
says em king pericles
come home twice six moons
obedient dooms
take crown sum
brought hither pentapolis
ravished regions round
everyone claps sound
heir apparent king
dreamt thought thing
brief must hence depart tyre
queen child makes desire
shall cross along go
omit dole woe
lychorida nurse takes
sea vessel shakes
neptune billow half flood
hath keel cut fortune mood
varies grisled north
disgorges tempest forth
duck life dives
poor ship drives
lady shrieks well near
fall travail fear
ensues fell storm
shall perform
nill relate action may
conveniently rest convey
might told
imagination hold
stage ship upon whose deck
sea tost pericles appears speak

exit



scene

enter pericles shipboard

pericles
thou god great vast rebuke surges
wash heaven hell thou hast
upon winds command bind brass
call deep still
thy deafening dreadful thunders gently quench
thy nimble sulphurous flashes lychorida
queen thou stormest venomously
wilt thou spit thyself seaman whistle
whisper ears death
unheard lychorida lucina
divinest patroness midwife gentle
cry night convey thy deity
aboard dancing boat make swift pangs
queen travails lychorida

enter lychorida infant

lychorida
thing young place
conceit would die
like take arms piece
dead queen

pericles
lychorida

lychorida
patience good sir assist storm
left living queen
little daughter sake
manly take comfort

pericles
gods
make us love goodly gifts
snatch straight away
recall give therein may
vie honour

lychorida
patience good sir
even charge

pericles
mild may thy life
blustrous birth never babe
quiet gentle thy conditions
thou art rudeliest welcome world
ever prince child happy follows
thou hast chiding nativity
fire air water earth heaven make
herald thee womb
even first thy loss
thy portage quit thou canst find
good gods throw best eyes upon

enter two sailors

first sailor
courage sir god save

pericles

hath done worst yet love
poor infant fresh new sea farer
would would quiet

thyself

sea room brine cloudy billow kiss moon care

lie till ship cleared dead

superstition

first sailor

strong custom therefore briefly yield must overboard
straight

pericles
think meet wretched queen

lychorida
lies sir

pericles
terrible childbed hast thou dear
light fire th unfriendly elements
forgot thee utterly time
give thee hallow thy grave straight
must cast thee scarcely coffin ooze
monument upon thy bones
e er remaining lamps belching whale
humming water must erwhelm thy corpse
lying simple shells lychorida
bid nestor bring spices ink paper
casket jewels bid nicander
bring satin coffer lay babe
upon pillow hie thee whiles say
priestly farewell suddenly woman

exit lychorida

second sailor

pericles

bring body presently

enter two gentlemen

topple pure surprise fear

cause trouble early
tis husbandry

say well

first gentleman
much marvel lordship
rich tire early hours
shake golden slumber repose
tis strange
nature conversant pain
thereto compell

cerimon
hold ever
virtue cunning endowments greater
nobleness riches careless heirs
may two latter darken expend
immortality attends former
making man god tis known ever
studied physic secret art
turning er authorities
together practice made familiar
aid blest infusions
dwell vegetives metals stones
speak disturbances
nature works cures doth give
content course true delight
thirsty tottering honour
tie pleasure silken bags
please fool death

charity hundreds call
creatures restored
knowledge personal pain even
purse still open hath built lord cerimon
strong renown time shall never

scene iii tarsus room cleon house

enter pericles cleon dionyza lychorida marina arms

pericles
honour cleon must needs gone
twelve months expired tyrus stands
litigious peace lady
take heart thankfulness gods
make rest upon

cleon
shafts fortune though hurt mortally
yet glance full wanderingly us

dionyza
sweet queen
strict fates pleased brought hither
bless mine eyes

pericles
obey
powers us could rage roar
doth sea lies yet end
must tis gentle babe marina
born sea named
charge charity withal
leaving infant care
beseeching give princely training
may manner born

cleon
fear lord think
grace fed country corn
people prayers still fall upon
must child thought neglection
therein make vile common body
relieved would force duty
nature need spur
gods revenge upon mine
end generation

pericles
believe
honour goodness teach
without vows till married madam
bright diana honour
unscissored shall hair mine remain
though show ill take leave
good madam make blessed care
bringing child

dionyza
one
shall dear respect
lord

madam thanks prayers

cleon
bring grace e en edge shore
give mask neptune
gentlest winds heaven

tears lychorida tears
look little mistress whose grace
may depend hereafter come lord

exeunt



scene iv ephesus room cerimon house

lay coffer

act iv

enter gower

scene tarsus open place near seashore

scene iii tarsus room cleon house

enter cleon dionyza

dionyza

sun moon ne er look upon

cleon
chief lord spacious world
give undo deed lady
much less blood virtue yet princess
equal single crown earth
justice compare villain leonine
thou hast poison
thou hadst drunk kindness
becoming well thy face canst thou say
noble pericles shall demand child

died night say cross
unless play pious innocent
honest attribute cry
died foul play

faults beneath heavens gods
like worst

coward spirit

whoever approbation added
though prime consent flow
honourable sources

dionyza

none know leonine gone
distain child stood

cast gazes marina face

whose expense tis done

doth swear gods winter kills flies

scene iv

enter gower monument marina tarsus

gower
thus time waste long leagues make short
sail seas cockles wish
making take imagination
bourn bourn region region
pardon commit crime
use one language several clime
scenes seem live beseech
learn stand gaps teach
stages story pericles
thwarting wayward seas
attended many lord knight
see daughter life delight
old helicanus goes along behind
left govern bear mind
old escanes helicanus late
advanced time great high estate
well sailing ships bounteous winds brought
king tarsus think pilot thought
steerage shall thoughts go
fetch daughter home first gone
like motes shadows see move awhile
ears unto eyes reconcile

dumb show enter pericles one door train cleon
dionyza cleon shows pericles tomb whereat pericles
makes lamentation puts sackcloth mighty passion departs
exeunt cleon dionyza

see belief may suffer foul show
borrow passion stands true old woe
pericles sorrow devour
sighs shot biggest tears ershower
leaves tarsus embarks swears
never wash face cut hairs
puts sackcloth sea bears
tempest mortal vessel tears
yet rides please wit
epitaph marina writ
wicked dionyza

reads inscription marina monument

fairest sweet st best lies
wither spring year
tyrus king daughter
foul death hath made slaughter
marina call birth
thetis proud swallow part earth
therefore earth fearing erflow
hath thetis birth child heavens bestow
wherefore swears never stint
make raging battery upon shores flint

visor become black villany
well soft tender flattery
let pericles believe daughter dead
bear courses ordered
lady fortune scene must play
daughter woe heavy well day
unholy service patience
think mytilene

act v

enter gower

gower
marina thus brothel scapes chances
honest house story says
sings like one immortal dances
goddess like admired lays
deep clerks dumbs nee le composes

even art sisters natural roses
inkle silk twin rubied cherry
pupils lacks none noble race
pour bounty gain
gives cursed bawd place
father turn thoughts
left sea lost

daughter dwells coast

god neptune annual feast keep whence
lysimachus tyrian ship espies

barge fervour hies
supposing put sight
heavy pericles think bark
done action might
shall discover please sit hark

exit

came gentle kind noble stock

pericles
hum ha

marina
maid
lord ne er invited eyes
gazed like comet speaks
lord may hath endured grief
might equal justly weigh
though wayward fortune malign state
derivation ancestors
stood equivalent mighty kings
time hath rooted parentage
world awkward casualties
bound servitude
aside desist
something glows upon cheek
whispers mine ear go till speak

pericles

equal mine thus say

marina

would violence

think pray turn eyes upon
like something country woman
shores

marina

yet mortally brought forth
appear

pericles
great woe shall deliver weeping
dearest wife like maid one
daughter might queen square brows
stature inch wand like straight
silver voiced eyes jewel like
cased richly pace another juno
starves ears feeds makes hungry
gives speech live

marina
stranger deck
may discern place

pericles
bred
achieved endowments
make rich owe

marina

like lies disdain reporting

pericles
prithee speak
falseness come thee thou look st
modest justice thou seem st palace
crown truth dwell believe thee
make senses credit thy relation
points seem impossible thou look st
like one loved indeed thy friends
didst thou say push thee back
perceived thee thou cam st
good descending

marina
indeed

pericles
report thy parentage think thou said st
thou hadst toss wrong injury
thou thought st thy griefs might equal mine
open

marina
thing
said said thoughts
warrant likely

pericles
tell thy story
thine consider prove thousand part
endurance thou art man
suffer like girl yet thou dost look
like patience gazing kings graves smiling
extremity act thy friends
lost thou thy name kind virgin
recount beseech thee come sit

marina
name marina

pericles
mock
thou incensed god sent hither
make world laugh

marina

cease

nay patient
thou little know st thou dost startle
call thyself marina

marina
name
given one power
father king

king daughter
call marina

marina
said would believe
troubler peace
end

pericles
flesh blood
working pulse fairy
motion well speak born
wherefore call marina

marina
call marina
born sea

pericles
sea mother

marina
mother daughter king
died minute born
good nurse lychorida hath oft
deliver weeping

pericles
stop little aside rarest dream e er
dull sleep
mock sad fools withal
daughter buried well bred
hear bottom story
never interrupt

marina
scorn believe twere best give er

pericles
believe syllable
shall deliver yet give leave
came parts bred

act


scene london room palace

enter king richard john gaunt nobles attendants

king richard
old john gaunt time honoured lancaster
hast thou according thy oath band
brought hither henry hereford thy bold son
make good boist rous late appeal
leisure would let us hear
duke norfolk thomas mowbray

gaunt
liege

king richard
tell moreover hast thou sounded
appeal duke ancient malice
worthily good subject
known ground treachery

gaunt
near could sift argument
apparent danger seen
aimed highness inveterate malice

king richard
call presence face face
frowning brow brow hear
accuser accused freely speak
high stomached full ire
rage deaf sea hasty fire

enter bolingbroke mowbray

bolingbroke
many years happy days befall
gracious sovereign loving liege

mowbray
day still better happiness
heavens envying earth good hap
add immortal title crown

king richard
thank yet one flatters us
well appeareth cause come
namely appeal high treason
cousin hereford dost thou object
duke norfolk thomas mowbray

bolingbroke
first heaven record speech
devotion subject love
tend ring precious safety prince
free misbegotten hate
come appellant princely presence
thomas mowbray turn thee
mark greeting well speak
body shall make good upon earth
divine soul answer heaven
thou art traitor miscreant
good bad live
since fair crystal sky
uglier seem clouds fly
aggravate note
foul traitor name stuff thy throat
wish please sovereign ere move
tongue speaks right drawn sword may prove

mowbray
let cold words accuse zeal
tis trial woman war
bitter clamour two eager tongues
arbitrate cause betwixt us twain
blood hot must cooled
yet tame patience boast
hushed naught say
first fair reverence highness curbs
giving reins spurs free speech
else would post returned
terms treason doubled throat
setting aside high blood royalty
let kinsman liege
defy spit
call slanderous coward villain
maintain would allow odds
meet tied run afoot
even frozen ridges alps
ground inhabitable
wherever englishman durst set foot
meantime let defend loyalty
hopes falsely doth lie

bolingbroke
pale trembling coward throw gage
disclaiming kindred king
lay aside high blood royalty
fear reverence makes thee except
guilty dread left thee much strength
take mine honour pawn stoop
rites knighthood else
make good thee arm arm
spoke thou canst worst devise

mowbray
take sword swear
gently laid knighthood shoulder
answer thee fair degree
chivalrous design knightly trial
mount alive may light
traitor unjustly fight

king richard
doth cousin lay mowbray charge
must great inherit us
much thought ill

bolingbroke
look speak life shall prove true
mowbray hath received eight thousand nobles
name lendings highness soldiers
hath detained lewd employments
like false traitor injurious villain
besides say battle prove
elsewhere furthest verge
ever surveyed english eye
treasons eighteen years
complotted contrived land
fetch false mowbray first head spring
say maintain
upon bad life make good
plot duke gloucester death
suggest soon believing adversaries
consequently like traitor coward
sluiced innocent soul streams blood
blood like sacrificing abel cries
even tongueless caverns earth
justice rough chastisement
glorious worth descent
arm shall life spent

king richard
high pitch resolution soars
thomas norfolk sayst thou

mowbray
let sovereign turn away face
bid ears little deaf
till told slander blood
god good men hate foul liar

king richard
mowbray impartial eyes ears
brother nay kingdom heir
father brother son
sceptre awe make vow
neighbour nearness sacred blood
nothing privilege partialize
unstooping firmness upright soul
subject mowbray art thou
free speech fearless thee allow

mowbray
bolingbroke low thy heart
false passage thy throat thou liest
three parts receipt calais
disbursed duly highness soldiers
part reserved consent
sovereign liege debt
upon remainder dear account
since last went france fetch queen
swallow lie gloucester death
slew disgrace
neglected sworn duty case
noble lord lancaster
honourable father foe
lay ambush life
trespass doth vex grieved soul
ere last received sacrament
confess exactly begged
grace pardon hope
fault rest appealed
issues rancour villain
recreant degenerate traitor
boldly defend
interchangeably hurl gage
upon overweening traitor foot
prove loyal gentleman
even best blood chambered bosom
haste whereof heartily pray
highness assign trial day

king richard
wrath kindled gentlemen ruled
let purge choler without letting blood
prescribe though physician
deep malice makes deep incision
forget forgive conclude agreed
doctors say month bleed
good uncle let end begun
calm duke norfolk son

gaunt
make peace shall become age
throw son duke norfolk gage

king richard
norfolk throw

gaunt
harry
obedience bids bid

king richard
norfolk throw bid boot

mowbray
throw dread sovereign thy foot
life thou shalt command shame
one duty owes fair name
despite death lives upon grave
dark dishonour use thou shalt
disgraced impeached baffled
pierced soul slander venomed spear
balm cure heart blood
breathed poison

king richard
rage must withstood
give gage lions make leopards tame

mowbray
yea change spots take shame
resign gage dear dear lord
purest treasure mortal times afford
spotless reputation away
men gilded loam painted clay
jewel ten times barred chest
bold spirit loyal breast
mine honour life grow one
take honour life done
dear liege mine honour let try
live die

king richard
cousin throw gage begin

bolingbroke
god defend soul deep sin
shall seem crest fallen father sight
pale beggar fear impeach height
outdared dastard ere tongue
shall wound honour feeble wrong
sound base parle teeth shall tear
slavish motive recanting fear
spit bleeding high disgrace
shame doth harbour even mowbray face

exit gaunt

king richard
born sue command
since make friends
ready lives shall answer
coventry upon saint lambert day
shall swords lances arbitrate
swelling difference settled hate
since atone shall see
justice design victor chivalry
lord marshal command officers arms
ready direct home alarms

exeunt

scene ii room duke lancaster palace

enter john gaunt duchess gloucester

gaunt
alas part woodstock blood
doth solicit exclaims
stir butchers life
since correction lieth hands
made fault correct
put quarrel heaven
see hours ripe earth
rain hot vengeance offenders heads

duchess
finds brotherhood thee sharper spur
hath love thy old blood living fire
edward seven sons whereof thyself art one
seven vials sacred blood
seven fair branches springing one root
seven dried nature course
branches destinies cut
thomas dear lord life gloucester
one vial full edward sacred blood
one flourishing branch royal root
cracked precious liquor spilt
hacked summer leaves faded
envy hand murder bloody axe
ah gaunt blood thine bed womb
metal self mould fashioned thee
made man though thou livest breathest
yet art thou slain thou dost consent
large measure thy father death
thou seest thy wretched brother die
model thy father life
call patience gaunt despair
suff ring thus thy brother slaughtered
thou showest naked pathway thy life
teaching stern murder butcher thee
mean men entitle patience
pale cold cowardice noble breasts
shall say safeguard thine life
best way venge gloucester death

gaunt
god quarrel god substitute
deputy anointed sight
hath caused death wrongfully
let heaven revenge may never lift
angry arm minister

duchess
alas may complain

gaunt
god widow champion defence

duchess
farewell old gaunt
thou goest coventry behold
cousin hereford fell mowbray fight
sit husband wrongs hereford spear
may enter butcher mowbray breast
misfortune miss first career
mowbray sins heavy bosom
may break foaming courser back
throw rider headlong lists
caitiff recreant cousin hereford
farewell old gaunt thy sometimes brother wife
companion grief must end life

gaunt
sister farewell must coventry
much good stay thee go

duchess
yet one word grief boundeth falls
empty hollowness weight
take leave begun
sorrow ends seemeth done
commend thy brother edmund york
lo nay yet depart
though quickly go
shall remember bid ah
good speed plashy visit
alack shall good old york see
empty lodgings unfurnished walls
unpeopled offices untrodden stones
hear welcome groans
therefore commend let come
seek sorrow dwells everywhere
desolate desolate hence die
last leave thee takes weeping eye

exeunt

whose youthful spirit regenerate

thy blessings steel lance point

mine innocence saint george thrive

king richard
let lay helmets spears
return back chairs
withdraw us let trumpets sound
return dukes decree

long flourish

combatants draw near
list council done
kingdom earth soiled
dear blood hath fostered
eyes hate dire aspect
civil wounds ploughed neighbours swords
think eagle winged pride
sky aspiring ambitious thoughts
rival hating envy set
wake peace country cradle
draws sweet infant breath gentle sleep
roused boist rous untuned drums
harsh resounding trumpets dreadful bray
grating shock wrathful iron arms
might quiet confines fright fair peace
make us wade even kindred blood
therefore banish territories
cousin hereford upon pain life
till twice five summers enriched fields
shall regreet fair dominions
tread stranger paths banishment

bolingbroke
done must comfort
sun warms shall shine
golden beams lent
shall point gild banishment

king richard
norfolk thee remains heavier doom
unwillingness pronounce
sly slow hours shall determinate
dateless limit thy dear exile
hopeless word never return
breathe thee upon pain life

mowbray
heavy sentence sovereign liege
unlooked highness mouth
dearer merit deep maim
cast forth common air
deserved highness hands
language learnt forty years
native english must forgo
tongue use
unstringed viol harp
like cunning instrument cased
open put hands
knows touch tune harmony
within mouth engaoled tongue
doubly portcullised teeth lips
dull unfeeling barren ignorance
made gaoler attend
old fawn upon nurse
far years pupil
thy sentence speechless death
robs tongue breathing native breath

king richard
boots thee compassionate
sentence plaining comes late

mowbray
thus turn country light
dwell solemn shades endless night

retiring

king richard
return take oath thee
lay royal sword banished hands
swear duty owe god
part therein banish
keep oath administer
never shall help truth god
embrace love banishment
never look upon face
never write regreet reconcile
louring tempest home bred hate
never advised purpose meet
plot contrive complot ill
gainst us state subjects land

bolingbroke
swear

mowbray
keep

bolingbroke
norfolk far mine enemy
time king permitted us
one souls wandered air
banished frail sepulchre flesh
flesh banished land
confess thy treasons ere thou fly realm
since thou hast far go bear along
clogging burden guilty soul

mowbray
bolingbroke ever traitor
name blotted book life
heaven banished hence
thou art god thou know
soon fear king shall rue
farewell liege way stray
save back england world way

exit

king richard
uncle even glasses thine eyes
see thy grieved heart thy sad aspect
hath number banished years
plucked four away bolingbroke six frozen winters spent
return welcome home banishment

bolingbroke
long time lies one little word
four lagging winters four wanton springs
end word breath kings

gaunt
thank liege regard
shortens four years son exile
little vantage shall reap thereby
ere six years hath spend
change moons bring times
oil dried lamp time bewasted light
shall extinct age endless night
inch taper burnt done
blindfold death let see son

king richard
uncle thou hast many years live

gaunt
minute king thou canst give
shorten days thou canst sullen sorrow
pluck nights lend morrow
thou canst help time furrow age
stop wrinkle pilgrimage
thy word current death
dead thy kingdom buy breath

king richard
thy son banished upon good advice
whereto thy tongue party verdict gave
justice seem st thou lour

gaunt
things sweet taste prove digestion sour
urged judge rather
would bid argue like father
stranger child
smooth fault mild
partial slander sought avoid
sentence life destroyed
alas looked say
strict make mine away
gave leave unwilling tongue
wrong

cousin farewell uncle bid
six years banish shall go

thou return st greeting thy friends

bolingbroke
joy absent grief present time

gaunt
six winters quickly gone

bolingbroke
men joy grief makes one hour ten

gaunt
call travel thou tak st pleasure

bolingbroke
heart sigh miscall
finds enforced pilgrimage

gaunt
sullen passage thy weary steps
esteem foil wherein thou art set
precious jewel thy home return

bolingbroke
nay rather every tedious stride make
remember deal world
wander jewels love
must serve long apprenticehood
foreign passages end
freedom boast nothing else
journeyman grief

gaunt
places eye heaven visits
wise man ports happy havens
teach thy necessity reason thus
virtue like necessity
think king banish thee
thou king woe doth heavier sit
perceives faintly borne
go say sent thee forth purchase honour
king exiled thee suppose
devouring pestilence hangs air
thou art flying fresher clime
look thy soul holds dear imagine
lie way thou goest whence thou com st
suppose singing birds musicians
grass whereon thou tread st presence strewed
flowers fair ladies thy steps
delightful measure dance
gnarling sorrow hath less power bite
man mocks sets light

bolingbroke
hold fire hand
thinking frosty caucasus
cloy hungry edge appetite
bare imagination feast
wallow naked december snow
thinking fantastic summer heat
apprehension good
gives greater feeling worse
fell sorrow tooth doth never rankle
bites lanceth sore

gaunt
come come son bring thee thy way
thy youth cause would stay

bolingbroke
england ground farewell sweet soil adieu
mother nurse bears yet
er wander boast
though banished yet true born englishman

exeunt

scene iv london room king castle

enter king richard green bagot one door aumerle another

king richard
observe cousin aumerle
far brought high hereford way

aumerle
brought high hereford call
next highway left

king richard
say store parting tears shed

aumerle
faith none except northeast wind
blew bitterly faces
awaked sleeping rheum chance
grace hollow parting tear

king richard
said cousin parted

aumerle
farewell
heart disdained tongue
profane word taught craft
counterfeit oppression grief
words seemed buried sorrow grave
marry would word farewell lengthened hours
added years short banishment
volume farewells
since would none

king richard
cousin cousin tis doubt
time shall call home banishment
whether kinsman come see friends
ourself bushy bagot green
observed courtship common people
seem dive hearts
humble familiar courtesy
reverence throw away slaves
wooing poor craftsmen craft smiles
patient underbearing fortune
twere banish affects
goes bonnet oyster wench
brace draymen bid god speed well
tribute supple knee
thanks countrymen loving friends
england reversion
subjects next degree hope

green
well gone go thoughts
rebels stand ireland
expedient manage must made liege
ere leisure yield means
advantage highness loss

king richard
ourself person war
coffers great court
liberal largess grown somewhat light
enforced farm royal realm
revenue whereof shall furnish us
affairs hand come short
substitutes home shall blank charters
whereto shall know men rich
shall subscribe large sums gold
send supply wants
make ireland presently

enter bushy

bushy news

act ii


scene london apartment ely house

gaunt couch duke york others standing

gaunt
king come may breathe last
wholesome counsel unstaid youth

york
vex strive breath
vain comes counsel ear

gaunt
say tongues dying men
enforce attention like deep harmony
words scarce seldom spent vain
breathe truth breathe words pain
must say listened
youth ease taught glose
men ends marked lives
setting sun music close
last taste sweets sweetest last
writ remembrance things long past
though richard life counsel would hear
death sad tale may yet undeaf ear

york
stopped flattering sounds
praises whose state wise fond
lascivious metres whose venom sound
open ear youth doth always listen
report fashions proud italy
whose manners still tardy apish nation
limps base imitation
doth world thrust forth vanity
new respect vile
quickly buzzed ears
late comes counsel heard
doth mutiny wit regard
direct whose way choose
tis breath thou lack st breath wilt thou lose

gaunt
methinks prophet new inspired
thus expiring foretell
rash fierce blaze riot last
violent fires soon burn
small showers last long sudden storms short
tires betimes spurs fast betimes
eager feeding food doth choke feeder
light vanity insatiate cormorant
consuming means soon preys upon
royal throne kings sceptered isle
earth majesty seat mars
eden demi paradise
fortress built nature
infection hand war
happy breed men little world
precious stone set silver sea
serves office wall
moat defensive house
envy less happier lands
blessed plot earth realm england
nurse teeming womb royal kings
feared breed famous birth
renowned deeds far home
christian service true chivalry
sepulchre stubborn jewry
world ransom blessed mary son
land dear souls dear dear land
dear reputation world
leased die pronouncing
like tenement pelting farm
england bound triumphant sea
whose rocky shore beats back envious siege
wat ry neptune bound shame
inky blots rotten parchment bonds
england wont conquer others
hath made shameful conquest
ah would scandal vanish life
happy ensuing death

enter king richard queen aumerle bushy green bagot ross

name befits composition
old gaunt indeed gaunt old
within grief hath kept tedious fast
abstains meat gaunt

watching breeds leanness leanness gaunt
pleasure fathers feed upon
strict fast mean children looks
therein fasting hast thou made gaunt
gaunt grave gaunt grave
whose hollow womb inherits nought bones

king richard
health breathe see thee ill

gaunt
made knows see thee ill
ill see thee seeing ill
thy death bed lesser thy land
wherein thou liest reputation sick
thou careless patient thou art
committ st thy anointed body cure
physicians first wounded thee
thousand flatterers sit within thy crown
whose compass bigger thy head
yet encaged small verge
waste whit lesser thy land
thy grandsire prophet eye
seen son son destroy sons
forth thy reach would laid thy shame
deposing thee thou wert possessed
art possessed depose thyself
cousin wert thou regent world
shame let land lease
thy world enjoying land
shame shame
landlord england art thou king
thy state law bondslave law
thou

king richard
lunatic lean witted fool
presuming ague privilege
darest thy frozen admonition
make pale cheek chasing royal blood
fury native residence
seat right royal majesty
wert thou brother great edward son
tongue runs roundly thy head
run thy head thy unreverent shoulders

gaunt
spare brother edward son
father edward son
blood already like pelican
hast thou tapped drunkenly caroused
brother gloucester plain well meaning soul
fair befall heaven mongst happy souls
may precedent witness good
thou respect st spilling edward blood
join present sickness
thy unkindness like crooked age
crop long withered flower
live thy shame die shame thee
words hereafter thy tormentors
convey bed grave
love live love honour

scene ii room castle

scene iv camp wales

enter earl salisbury welsh captain

captain

crossly thy good fortune goes

act iii


scene bristol bolingbroke camp

scene ii coast wales castle view

barkloughly castle call hand

late tossing breaking seas

king richard
needs must like well weep joy
stand upon kingdom
dear earth salute thee hand
though rebels wound thee horses hoofs
long parted mother child
plays fondly tears smiles meeting
weeping smiling greet thee earth
thee favours royal hands
feed thy sovereign foe gentle earth
thy sweets comfort ravenous sense
let thy spiders suck thy venom
heavy gaited toads lie way
annoyance treacherous feet
usurping steps trample thee
yield stinging nettles mine enemies
thy bosom pluck flower
guard pray thee lurking adder
whose double tongue may mortal touch
throw death upon thy sovereign enemies
mock senseless conjuration lords
earth shall feeling stones
prove armed soldiers ere native king
shall falter foul rebellion arms

hath power keep king spite
means heaven yields must embraced
neglected else heaven would
heaven offer refuse
proffered means succour redress

whilst bolingbroke security
grows strong great substance power

searching eye heaven hid
behind globe lights lower world
thieves robbers range abroad unseen
murders outrage boldly
terrestrial ball
fires proud tops eastern pines
darts light every guilty hole
murders treasons detested sins
cloak night plucked backs
stand bare naked trembling
thief traitor bolingbroke
hath revelled night
whilst wand ring antipodes
shall see us rising throne east
treasons sit blushing face
able endure sight day
self affrighted tremble sin
water rough rude sea
wash balm anointed king
breath worldly men depose
deputy elected lord
every man bolingbroke hath pressed
lift shrewd steel golden crown
god richard hath heavenly pay
glorious angel angels fight
weak men must fall heaven still guards right

enter salisbury

welcome lord far lies power

awake thou coward majesty thou sleepest

enter sir stephen scroop

scroop

care tuned tongue deliver

serve fellow

bear tidings calamity

world dissolved tears
high limits swells rage
bolingbroke covering fearful land
hard bright steel hearts harder steel
whitebeards armed thin hairless scalps
thy majesty boys women voices
strive speak big clap female joints
stiff unwieldy arms thy crown
thy beadsmen learn bend bows
double fatal yew thy state
yea distaff women manage rusty bills

goes worse power tell

well well thou tell st tale ill
earl wiltshire bagot
become bushy green
let dangerous enemy
measure confines peaceful steps

snakes heart blood warmed sting heart

make war upon spotted souls

heads hands curse

lie full low graved hollow ground

bushy green earl wiltshire dead

aumerle
duke father power

king richard

let talk graves worms epitaphs

write sorrow bosom earth
let choose executors talk wills
yet bequeath
save deposed bodies ground
lands lives bolingbroke
nothing call death
small model barren earth
serves paste cover bones
god sake let us sit upon ground
tell sad stories death kings
deposed slain war
haunted ghosts deposed
poisoned wives sleeping killed
murdered within hollow crown
rounds mortal temples king
keeps death court antic sits
scoffing state grinning pomp
allowing breath little scene
monarchize feared kill looks
infusing self vain conceit
flesh walls life
brass impregnable humoured thus
comes last little pin
bores castle wall farewell king
cover heads mock flesh blood
solemn reverence throw away respect
tradition form ceremonious duty
mistook
live bread like feel want
taste grief need friends subjected thus
say king

presently prevent ways wail
fear foe since fear oppresseth strength
gives weakness strength unto foe
follies fight

fight die death destroying death
fearing dying pays death servile breath

father hath power enquire
learn make body limb

easy task win

upon party

thou hast said enough
aumerle beshrew thee cousin didst lead forth
sweet way despair
say comfort

bids comfort
go flint castle pine away

scene iv langley duke york garden

gardener

like unruly children make sire

give supportance bending twigs

act iv


scene westminster hall

lords spiritual right side throne lords

scorns unsay hath delivered
dead time gloucester death plotted
heard say arm length
reacheth restful english court
far calais mine uncle head
amongst much talk time
heard say rather refuse

cousin death

princes noble lords
answer shall make base man
shall much dishonour fair stars
equal terms give chastisement

attainder slanderous lips
gage manual seal death
marks thee hell say thou liest
maintain thou hast said false
thy heart blood though base
stain temper knightly sword

presence hath moved

marry god forbid
worst royal presence may speak

enough noble upright judge

subject give sentence king

thieves judged hear
although apparent guilt seen

captain steward deputy elect

show heinous black obscene deed

stirred god thus boldly king

foul traitor proud hereford king

alack sent king
shook regal thoughts
wherewith reigned hardly yet learned
insinuate flatter bow bend knee

ay ay must nothing
therefore resign thee
mark undo
give heavy weight head
unwieldy sceptre hand

mine tears wash away balm

mine tongue deny sacred state
mine breath release duteous oaths
pomp majesty forswear
manors rents revenues forgo
acts decrees statutes deny
god pardon oaths broke
god keep vows unbroke made thee
make nothing nothing grieved
thou pleased hast achieved
long mayst thou live richard seat sit
soon lie richard earthly pit

send many years sunshine days

may deem worthily deposed

must must ravel
weaved follies gentle northumberland

containing deposing king
cracking strong warrant oath
marked blot damned book heaven

though pilate wash hands
showing outward pity yet pilates
delivered sour cross
water wash away sin

see sort traitors

given soul consent
undeck pompous body king

proud majesty subject state peasant

act v


scene london street leading tower

enter queen ladies

queen
way king come way
julius caesar ill erected tower
whose flint bosom condemned lord
doomed prisoner proud bolingbroke
let us rest rebellious earth
resting true king queen

enter king richard guard

soft see rather see
fair rose wither yet look behold
pity may dissolve dew
wash fresh true love tears
ah thou model old troy stand
thou map honour thou king richard tomb
king richard thou beauteous inn
hard favoured grief lodged thee
triumph become alehouse guest

king richard
join grief fair woman
make end sudden learn good soul
think former state happy dream
awaked truth
shows us sworn brother sweet
grim necessity
keep league till death hie thee france
cloister thee religious house
holy lives must win new world crown
profane hours thrown

queen
richard shape mind
transformed weakened hath bolingbroke
deposed thine intellect hath thy heart
lion dying thrusteth forth paw
wounds earth nothing else rage
erpowered wilt thou pupil like
take correction mildly kiss rod
fawn rage base humility
art lion king beasts

king richard
king beasts indeed aught beasts
still happy king men
good sometimes queen prepare thee hence france
think dead even thou tak st
death bed thy last living leave
winter tedious nights sit fire
good old folks let tell thee tales
woeful ages long ago betid
ere thou bid good night quit griefs
tell thou lamentable tale
send hearers weeping beds
senseless brands sympathize
heavy accent thy moving tongue
compassion weep fire
mourn ashes coal black
deposing rightful king

enter northumberland attended

northumberland
lord mind bolingbroke changed
must pomfret unto tower
madam order ta en
swift speed must away france

king richard
northumberland thou ladder wherewithal
mounting bolingbroke ascends throne
time shall many hours age
ere foul sin gathering head
shall break corruption thou shalt think
though divide realm give thee half
little helping
shall think thou knowst way
plant unrightful kings wilt know
ne er little urged another way
pluck headlong usurped throne
love wicked men converts fear
fear hate hate turns one
worthy danger deserved death

northumberland
guilt head end
take leave part must part forthwith

king richard
doubly divorced bad men violate
twofold marriage twixt crown
betwixt married wife
let unkiss oath twixt thee
yet kiss twas made
part us northumberland towards north
shivering cold sickness pines clime
wife france whence set forth pomp
came adorned hither like sweet may
sent back like hallowmas short st day

queen
must divided must part

king richard
ay hand hand love heart heart

queen
banish us send king

northumberland
love little policy

queen
whither goes thither let go

king richard
two together weeping make one woe
weep thou france thee
better far near ne er near
go count thy way sighs mine groans

queen
longest way shall longest moans

king richard
twice one step groan way short
piece way heavy heart
come come wooing sorrow let brief
since wedding length grief
one kiss shall stop mouths dumbly part
thus give mine thus take thy heart

kiss

queen
give mine twere good part
take keep kill thy heart

kiss

mine gone
may strive kill groan

king richard
make woe wanton fond delay
adieu rest let sorrow say

exeunt

scene ii room duke york palace

york
said duke great bolingbroke
mounted upon hot fiery steed
aspiring rider seemed know
slow stately pace kept course
whilst tongues cried god save thee bolingbroke
would thought windows spake
many greedy looks young old
casements darted desiring eyes
upon visage walls
painted imagery said
jesu preserve thee welcome bolingbroke
whilst one side turning
bareheaded lower proud steed neck
bespake thus thank countrymen
thus still thus passed along

duchess
alack poor richard rode whilst

york
theatre eyes men
well graced actor leaves stage
idly bent enters next
thinking prattle tedious
even much contempt men eyes
scowl gentle richard man cried god save
joyful tongue gave welcome home
dust thrown upon sacred head
gentle sorrow shook
face still combating tears smiles
badges grief patience
god strong purpose steeled
hearts men must perforce melted
barbarism pitied
heaven hath hand events
whose high bound calm contents
bolingbroke sworn subjects
whose state honour aye allow

enter aumerle

news oxford jousts triumphs hold

teeming date drunk time

keep

done thou wouldst pitiful

disloyal thy bed
bastard thy son
sweet york sweet husband mind
like thee man may
like kin
yet love

exit

duchess

long behind though old

never rise ground
till bolingbroke pardoned thee away gone

exeunt

scene iii windsor room castle

enter bolingbroke king harry percy lords

king henry
man tell unthrifty son
tis full three months since see last
plague hang us tis
would god lords might found
inquire london mongst taverns
say daily doth frequent
unrestrained loose companions
even say stand narrow lanes
beat watch rob passengers
young wanton effeminate boy
takes point honour support
dissolute crew

percy
lord two days since saw prince
told triumphs held oxford

king henry
said gallant

percy
answer would unto stews
common st creature pluck glove
wear favour
would unhorse lustiest challenger

king henry
dissolute desperate yet
see sparks better hope elder years
may happily bring forth comes

enter aumerle

aumerle
king

means cousin stares looks wildly

aumerle

conference grace alone

exeunt harry percy lords

matter cousin

aumerle

tongue cleave roof within mouth
unless pardon ere rise speak

intended committed fault
first heinous e er
win thy love pardon thee

aumerle
give leave may turn key
man enter till tale done

king henry
thy desire

aumerle locks door

york
