scene scene iii

enter palamon bush

palamon
houre cosen gave faith
visit againe bring
two swords two good armors faile
neither man souldier left
thinke weeke could restord
lost strength growne low
crest falne wants thanke thee arcite
thou art yet faire foe feele selfe
refreshing able againe
dure danger delay longer
would make world think comes hearing
lay fatting like swine fight
souldier therefore blest morning
shall last sword refuses
hold kill tis iustice
love fortune good morrow

enter arcite armors swords

arcite
good morrow noble kinesman

palamon
put much paines sir

arcite
much faire cosen
debt honour duty

palamon
would sir could wish ye
kinde kinsman force finde
beneficiall foe embraces
might thanke ye blowes

arcite
shall thinke either well done
noble recompence

palamon
shall quit

arcite
defy faire termes show
mistris anger
love thing honourable
bred talke man arm
upon guards let fury
like meeting two tides fly strongly us
birthright beauty
truely pertaines without obbraidings scornes
dispisings persons powtings
fitter girles schooleboyes seene
quickly mine wilt please arme sir
feele selfe fitting yet
furnishd old strength ile stay cosen
ev ry day discourse health
spard person friends
could wish saide lov
though dide loving lady
justifying love must fly

palamon
arcite thou art brave enemy
man thy cosen fit kill thee
well lusty choose armes

arcite
choose sir

palamon
wilt thou exceede st thou doe
make spare thee

arcite
thinke cosen
deceived soldier
spare

palamon
well said

arcite
l finde

palamon
honest man love
justice affection
ile pay thee soundly ile take

arcite
mine
ile arme first

palamon
pray thee tell cosen
gotst thou good armour

arcite
tis dukes
say true stole doe pinch

palamon
noe

arcite
heavie

palamon
worne lighter
shall make serve

arcite
ile buckl close

palamon
meanes

arcite
care grand guard

palamon
wee l use horses perceave
would faine fight

arcite
indifferent

palamon
faith good cosen thrust buckle
far enough

arcite
warrant

palamon
caske

arcite
fight bare armd

palamon
shall nimbler

arcite
use gauntlets though th least
prethee take mine good cosen

palamon
thanke arcite
doe looke falne much away

arcite
faith little love usd kindly

palamon
ile warrant thee ile strike home

arcite
doe spare
ile give cause sweet cosen

palamon
sir
thinkes armor like arcite
thou wor st day kings fell lighter

arcite
good one day
well remember outdid cosen
never saw valour chargd
vpon left wing enemie
spurd hard come
right good horse

palamon
indeede bright bay remember

arcite
yes
vainely labour outwent
could wishes reach yet little
imitation

palamon
vertue
modest cosen

arcite
saw charge first
thought heard dreadfull clap thunder
breake troope

palamon
still flew
lightning valour stay little
peece streight

arcite
tis well

palamon
would nothing hurt thee sword
bruise would dishonour

arcite
perfect

palamon
stand

arcite
take sword hold better

palamon
thanke ye keepe life lyes
one hold aske
hopes cause honour guard bow
severall wayes advance stand

arcite
love ought else say

palamon
onely thou art mine aunts son
blood desire shed mutuall
thine thee mine sword
hand thou killst
gods forgive thee
place prepar sleepe honour

doctor
intemprat surfeit eye hath distemperd sences
may returne settle againe execute preordaind
faculties extravagant vagary
must doe confine place light may rather seeme
steale permitted take vpon yong sir friend
name palamon say come eate commune love

objects inserted tweene minde eye become prankes

sayes palamon hath sung prison come stucke sweet
flowers season mistres thereto make addition
som compounded odours grateful sence
shall become palamon palamon sing palamon sweet

still among intermingle petition grace acceptance

scene temples mars venus diana

enter palamon arcite knights

sir enter

theseus
valiant strong harted enemies
royall german foes day come
blow furnesse flames betweene ye
lay anger houre dove like
holy altars helpers
feard gods bow downe stubborne bodies
ire mortall helpe
gods regard ye fight iustice
ile leave prayers betwixt ye
part wishes

honour crowne worthiest exit theseus traine

palamon
glasse running finish
till one us expire thinke thus
ought strove show
mine enemy businesse wer one eye
another arme opprest arme
would destroy th offender coz would
though parcell selfe gather
tender

arcite
labour
push name auncient love kindred
memory th selfe place

heavenly lymiter pleases

turne let embrace thee cosen

palamon

knights

arcite
farewell sir
knights kinsemen lovers yea sacrifices
true worshippers mars whose spirit
expells seedes feare th apprehension
still farther goe
god profession
require hearts lyons
breath tigers yea fearcenesse
yea speed also goe meane
else wish snayles know prize
must drag blood force great feate
must put garland stickes
queene flowers intercession
must makes campe cestron
brymd blood men give aide
bend spirits towards kneele
thou mighty one thy power hast turnd
greene neptune purple whose approach
comets prewarne whose havocke vaste feild
vnearthed skulls proclaime whose breath blowes downe
teeming ceres foyzon doth plucke
hand armypotent forth blew clowdes
masond turrets mak st break st
stony girthes citties thy puple
yongest follower thy drom instruct day
military skill thy lawde
may advance streamer thee
stil lord th day give great mars
token thy pleasure

fall faces formerly heard
clanging armor short thunder burst
battaile
whereupon rise bow altar

great corrector enormous times
shaker ore rank states thou grand decider
dustie old tytles healst blood
earth sicke curst world
th pluresie people doe take
thy signes auspiciously thy name
designe march boldly let us goe exeunt

enter palamon knights former observance

palamon
stars must glister new fire
daie extinct argument love
goddesse grant gives
victory blend spirits mine
whose free noblenesse doe make cause
personall hazard goddesse venus
commend proceeding implore
power unto partie kneele formerly
haile soveraigne queene secrets hast power
call feircest tyrant rage
weepe unto girle ha st might
even ey glance choke marsis drom
turne th allarme whispers canst make
criple florish crutch cure
apollo may st force king
subjects vassaile induce
stale gravitie daunce pould bachelour
whose youth like wonton boyes bonfyres
skipt thy flame seaventy thou canst catch
make scorne hoarse throate
abuse yong laies love godlike power
hast thou power upon phoebus thou
add st flames hotter heavenly fyres
scortch mortall son thine huntresse
moyst cold say began throw
bow away sigh take thy grace
thy vowd souldier doe beare thy yoke
wer wreath roses yet heavier
lead selfe stings nettles
never beene foule mouthd thy law
nev r reveald secret knew none would
kend never practised
vpon mans wife would libells reade
liberall wits never great feastes
sought betray beautie blush
simpring sirs beene harsh
large confessors hotly ask
mothers one woman
women wer wrong knew man
eightie winters told
lasse foureteene brided twas thy power
put life dust aged crampe
screw square foote round
gout knit fingers knots
torturing convulsions globie eyes
almost drawne spheeres life
seem torture anatomie
yong faire pheare boy
beleev swore
would beleeve briefe
prate done companion
boast defyer
would rejoycer
yea doe love tells close offices
fowlest way names concealements
boldest language one
vow lover never yet made sigh
truer soft sweet goddesse
give victory question
true loves merit blesse signe
thy great pleasure

musicke heard doves seene flutter fall
againe upon faces knees

palamon
thou eleven ninetie raign st
mortall bosomes whose chase world
heards thy game give thee thankes
faire token layd unto
mine innocent true heart armes assurance bow
body businesse let us rise
bow goddesse time comes exeunt

still musicke records

enter emilia white haire shoulders wearing
wheaten wreath one white holding traine haire stucke
flowers one carrying silver hynde
conveyd incense sweet odours set upon altar
diana maides standing loofe sets fire
curtsey kneele

emilia
sacred shadowie cold constant queene
abandoner revells mute contemplative
sweet solitary white chaste pure
windefand snow thy femall knights
alow st blood make blush
orders robe heere thy priest
humbled fore thine altar vouchsafe
thy rare greene eye never yet
beheld thing maculate looke thy virgin
sacred silver mistris lend thine eare
nev r heard scurrill terme whose port
ne entred wanton found petition
seasond holy feare last
vestall office bride habited
mayden harted husband pointed
doe know two
choose one pray successe
guiltlesse election mine eyes
loose one equall precious
could doombe neither perish
goe unsentenc therefore modest queene
two pretenders best loves
truest title n let
take wheaten gerland else grant
fyle qualitie hold may
continue thy band

hynde vanishes altar place ascends
rose tree one rose upon

see generall ebbs flowes
bowells holy altar
sacred act advances one rose
well inspird battaile shal confound
brave knights virgin flowre
must grow alone unpluck

heard sodaine twang instruments rose fals
tree vanishes altar

flowre falne tree descends mistris
thou dischargest shall gather
thinke know thine owne
vnclaspe thy misterie hope pleas
signes gratious curtsey exeunt

scene darkened room prison

enter doctor iaylor wooer habite palamon

doctor
advice told done good upon

wooer
much maids kept company
halfe perswaded palamon
within halfe houre came smiling
asked would eate would kisse

epilogue

would aske ye ye like play
schoole boyes say
cruell fearefull pray yet stay
let looke upon ye man smile
goes hard see
lov yong hansome wench show face
tis strange none heere
conscience let hisse kill
market tis vaine see stay yee
worst come say ye
yet mistake bold
cause tale told
tis way content ye
honest purpose ment ye
end ye shall ere long
dare say many better prolong
old loves us might
rest service gentlemen good night florish

camillo
gracious lord
may negligent foolish fearful
every one man free
negligence folly fear
among infinite doings world
sometime puts forth affairs lord
ever wilful negligent
folly industriously
play fool negligence
weighing well end ever fearful
thing issue doubted
whereof execution cry
non performance twas fear
oft affects wisest lord
allow infirmities honesty
never free beseech grace
plainer let know trespass
visage deny
tis none mine

leontes
ha seen camillo
past doubt eye glass
thicker cuckold horn heard
vision apparent rumour
mute thought cogitation
resides man think
wife slippery thou wilt confess
else impudently negative
eyes ears thought say
wife hobby horse deserves name
rank flax wench puts
troth plight say justify

camillo
would stander hear
sovereign mistress clouded without
present vengeance taken shrew heart
never spoke become less
reiterate sin
deep though true

leontes
whispering nothing
leaning cheek cheek meeting noses
kissing inside lip stopping career
laughter sigh note infallible
breaking honesty horsing foot foot
skulking corners wishing clocks swift
hours minutes noon midnight eyes
blind pin web
would unseen wicked nothing
world nothing
covering sky nothing bohemia nothing
wife nothing nothing nothings
nothing

diseas opinion betimes

wears like medal hanging
neck bohemia
servants true bare eyes
see alike mine honour profits
particular thrifts would
undo ay thou
cupbearer meaner form
bench rear worship mayst see
plainly heaven sees earth earth sees heaven
galled mightst bespice cup
give mine enemy lasting wink
draught cordial

could rash potion
ling ring dram work
maliciously like poison
believe crack dread mistress
sovereignly honourable
lov thee

leontes
make thy question go rot
dost think muddy unsettled
appoint vexation sully
purity whiteness sheets
preserve sleep spotted
goads thorns nettles tails wasps
give scandal blood th prince son
think mine love mine
without ripe moving would

come poor babe

fill becoming pure white robes

became two spouts fury spent anon
break good antigonus
since fate thy better disposition
hath made thy person thrower

either life death upon earth
right father blossom speed thee well lie thy
character

laying child bundle

may fortune please breed thee pretty
still rest thine storm begins poor wretch
thy mother fault art thus expos

well may get aboard chase
gone ever

enter old shepherd

lover complaint



hill whose concave womb reworded
plaintful story sist ring vale
spirits attend double voice accorded
laid list sad tun tale
ere long espied fickle maid full pale
tearing papers breaking rings twain
storming world sorrow wind rain

upon head platted hive straw
fortified visage sun
whereon thought might think sometime saw
carcass beauty spent done
time scythed youth begun
youth quit spite heaven fell rage
beauty peeped lattice sear age

oft heave napkin eyne
conceited characters
laund ring silken figures brine
seasoned woe pelleted tears
often reading contents bears
often shrieking undistinguish woe
clamours size high low

sometimes levell eyes carriage ride
batt ry spheres intend
sometime diverted poor balls tied
th orbed earth sometimes extend
view right anon gazes lend
every place nowhere fix
mind sight distractedly commix

hair loose tied formal plat
proclaim careless hand pride
untuck descended sheav hat
hanging pale pined cheek beside
threaden fillet still bide
true bondage would break thence
though slackly braided loose negligence

thousand favours maund drew
amber crystal beaded jet
one one river threw
upon whose weeping margent set
like usury applying wet wet
monarchs hands lets bounty fall
want cries excess begs

folded schedules many one
perus sigh tore gave flood
crack many ring posied gold bone
bidding find sepulchres mud
found yet mo letters sadly penn blood
sleided silk feat affectedly
enswath seal curious secrecy

often bath fluxive eyes
often kiss often gave tear
cried false blood thou register lies
unapproved witness dost thou bear
ink would seem black damned
said top rage lines rents
big discontent breaking contents

reverend man grazed cattle nigh
sometime blusterer ruffle knew
court city let go
swiftest hours observed flew
towards afflicted fancy fastly drew
privileg age desires know
brief grounds motives woe

slides upon grained bat
comely distant sits side
desires sat
grievance hearing divide
may aught applied
may suffering ecstasy assuage
tis promised charity age

father says though behold
injury many blasting hour
let tell judgement old
age sorrow hath power
might yet spreading flower
fresh self applied
love love beside

woe early attended
youthful suit gain grace
one nature outwards commended
maiden eyes stuck face
love lack dwelling made place
fair parts abide
new lodg newly deified

browny locks hang crooked curls
every light occasion wind
upon lips silken parcels hurls
sweet aptly find
eye saw enchant mind
visage little drawn
largeness thinks paradise sawn

small show man yet upon chin
phoenix began appear
like unshorn velvet termless skin
whose bare bragg web seemed wear
yet show visage cost dear
nice affections wavering stood doubt
best best without

qualities beauteous form
maiden tongued thereof free
yet men mov storm
oft twixt may april see
winds breathe sweet unruly though
rudeness authoriz youth
livery falseness pride truth

well could ride often men would say
horse mettle rider takes
proud subjection noble sway
rounds bounds course stop makes
controversy hence question takes
whether horse became deed
manage th well steed

quickly side verdict went
real habitude gave life grace
appertainings ornament
accomplish case
aids made fairer place
came additions yet purpos trim
piec grace grac

tip subduing tongue
kind arguments question deep
replication prompt reason strong
advantage still wake sleep
make weeper laugh laugher weep
dialect different skill
catching passions craft

general bosom reign
young old sexes enchanted
dwell thoughts remain
personal duty following haunted
consent bewitch ere desire granted
dialogued would say
ask wills made wills obey

many picture get
serve eyes put mind
like fools th imagination set
goodly objects abroad find
lands mansions thought assign
labouring moe pleasures bestow
true gouty landlord doth owe

many never touch hand
sweetly suppos mistress heart
woeful self freedom stand
fee simple part
art youth youth art
threw affections charmed power
reserv stalk gave flower

yet equals
demand desired yielded
finding honour forbid
safest distance mine honour shielded
experience many bulwarks builded
proofs new bleeding remain foil
false jewel amorous spoil

ah ever shunn precedent
destin ill must assay
force examples gainst content
put pass perils way
counsel may stop stay
rage advice often seen
blunting us make wills keen

gives satisfaction blood
must curb upon others proof
forbode sweets seems good
fear harms preach behoof
appetite judgement stand aloof
one palate hath needs taste
though reason weep cry thy last

could say man untrue
knew patterns foul beguiling
heard plants others orchards grew
saw deceits gilded smiling
knew vows ever brokers defiling
thought characters words merely art
bastards foul adulterate heart

long upon terms held city
till thus gan besiege gentle maid
suffering youth feeling pity
holy vows afraid
ye sworn none ever said
feasts love call unto
till ne er invite never woo

offences abroad see
errors blood none mind
love made acture may
neither party true kind
sought shame shame find
much less shame remains
much reproach contains

among many mine eyes seen
one whose flame heart much warmed
affection put th smallest teen
leisures ever charmed
harm done ne er harmed
kept hearts liveries mine free
reign commanding monarchy

look tributes wounded fancies sent
pallid pearls rubies red blood
figuring passions likewise lent
grief blushes aptly understood
bloodless white encrimson mood
effects terror dear modesty
encamp hearts fighting outwardly

lo behold talents hair
twisted metal amorously empleach
receiv many several fair
kind acceptance weepingly beseech
th annexions fair gems enrich
deep brain sonnets amplify
stone dear nature worth quality

diamond twas beautiful hard
whereto invis properties tend
deep green emerald whose fresh regard
weak sights sickly radiance amend
heaven hued sapphire opal blend
objects manifold several stone
wit well blazon smil made moan

lo trophies affections hot
pensiv subdued desires tender
nature hath charg hoard
yield must render
origin ender
force must oblations
since altar empatron

advance phraseless hand
whose white weighs airy scale praise
take similes command
hallowed sighs burning lungs raise
minister obeys
works audit comes
distract parcels combined sums

lo device sent nun
sister sanctified holiest note
late noble suit court shun
whose rarest havings made blossoms dote
sought spirits richest coat
kept cold distance thence remove
spend living eternal love

sweet labour leave
thing mast ring strives
planing place form receive
playing patient sports unconstrained gyves
fame contrives
scars battle scapeth flight
makes absence valiant might

pardon boast true
accident brought eye
upon moment force subdue
would caged cloister fly
religious love put religion eye
tempted would immur
tempt liberty procur

mighty hear tell
broken bosoms belong
emptied fountains well
mine pour ocean among
strong er er strong
must victory us congest

ii

sweet cytherea sitting brook
young adonis lovely fresh green

looks none could look beauty queen

fell back fair queen toward
rose ran away ah fool froward

iii

love make forsworn shall swear love
never faith could hold beauty vow
though forsworn thee constant prove
thoughts like oaks thee like osiers bow

knowledge mark know thee shall suffice
well learned tongue well thee commend
ignorant soul sees thee without wonder
praise thy parts admire
thy eye jove lightning seems thy voice dreadful thunder
anger bent music sweet fire
celestial thou art love wrong
sing heavens praise earthly tongue

fair love fair fickle

none fairer none falser deface

many tales please hath coin

yet midst pure protestings
faith oaths tears jestings

bad best though excellent neither

argument

lucius tarquinius excessive pride surnamed superbus
caused father law servius tullius cruelly
murdered contrary roman laws customs requiring
staying people suffrages possessed

discourses supper every one commended virtues
wife among collatinus extolled incomparable chastity

every one avouched collatinus finds

locks chamber

lighted light spies

add rejoicing prime

huge rocks high winds strong pirates shelves sands

yielding latch

back resolution

blackest sin clear absolution

sees lurking serpent steps aside

lies mercy mortal sting

chamber wickedly stalks
gazeth yet unstained bed
curtains close walks
rolling greedy eyeballs head
high treason heart misled

draw cloud hides silver moon

look fair fiery pointed sun

whether reflects bright
dazzleth else shame supposed
blind keep enclosed

darksome prison died
seen period ill
collatine lucrece side

must ope blessed league kill

must sell joy life world delight

lily hand rosy cheek lies
cozening pillow lawful kiss
therefore angry seems part sunder
swelling either side want bliss
whose hills head entombed
like virtuous monument lies
admir lewd unhallow eyes

without bed fair hand
green coverlet whose perfect white
show like april daisy grass
pearly sweat resembling dew night
eyes like marigolds sheath light
canopied darkness sweetly lay
till might open adorn day

hair like golden threads play breath
modest wantons wanton modesty
showing life triumph map death
death dim look life mortality
sleep beautify
twain strife
life liv death death life

breasts like ivory globes circled blue
pair maiden worlds unconquered
save lord bearing yoke knew
oath truly honoured
worlds tarquin new ambition bred
like foul usurper went
fair throne heave owner

could see mightily noted
note strongly desir
beheld firmly doted
wilful eye tir
admiration admir
azure veins alabaster skin
coral lips snow white dimpled chin

grim lion fawneth er prey
sharp hunger conquest satisfied
er sleeping soul doth tarquin stay
rage lust grazing qualified
slack suppress standing side
eye late mutiny restrains
unto greater uproar tempts veins

like straggling slaves pillage fighting
obdurate vassals fell exploits effecting
bloody death ravishment delighting
children tears mothers groans respecting
swell pride onset still expecting
anon beating heart alarum striking
gives hot charge bids liking

drumming heart cheers burning eye
eye commends leading hand
hand proud dignity
smoking pride march make stand
bare breast heart land
whose ranks blue veins hand scale
left round turrets destitute pale

mustering quiet cabinet
dear governess lady lies
tell dreadfully beset
fright confusion cries
much amaz breaks ope lock eyes
peeping forth tumult behold
flaming torch dimm controll

imagine one dead night
forth dull sleep dreadful fancy waking
thinks hath beheld ghastly sprite
whose grim aspect sets every joint shaking
terror worser taking
sleep disturbed heedfully doth view
sight makes supposed terror true

wrapp confounded thousand fears
like new kill bird trembling lies
dares look yet winking appears
quick shifting antics ugly eyes
shadows weak brain forgeries
angry eyes fly lights
darkness daunts dreadful sights

hand yet remains upon breast
rude ram batter ivory wall
may feel heart poor citizen distress
wounding death rise fall
beating bulk hand shakes withal
moves rage lesser pity
make breach enter sweet city

first like trumpet doth tongue begin
sound parley heartless foe
er white sheet peers whiter chin
reason rash alarm know
dumb demeanour seeks show
vehement prayers urgeth still
colour commits ill

thus replies colour thy face
even anger makes lily pale
red rose blush disgrace
shall plead tell loving tale
colour come scale
thy never conquer fort fault thine
thine eyes betray thee unto mine

thus forestall thee thou mean chide
thy beauty hath ensnared thee night
thou patience must abide
marks thee earth delight
conquer sought might
reproof reason beat dead
thy bright beauty newly bred

see crosses attempt bring
know thorns growing rose defends
think honey guarded sting
beforehand counsel comprehends
deaf hears heedful friends
hath eye gaze beauty
dotes looks gainst law duty

debated even soul
wrong shame sorrow shall breed
nothing affection course control
stop headlong fury speed
know repentant tears ensue deed
reproach disdain deadly enmity
yet strike embrace mine infamy

said shakes aloft roman blade
like falcon towering skies
coucheth fowl wings shade
whose crooked beak threats mount dies
insulting falchion lies
harmless lucretia marking tells
trembling fear fowl hear falcon bells

lucrece quoth night must enjoy thee
thou deny force must work way
thy bed purpose destroy thee
done worthless slave thine slay
kill thine honour thy life decay
thy dead arms mean place
swearing slew seeing thee embrace

thy surviving husband shall remain
scornful mark every open eye
thy kinsmen hang heads disdain
thy issue blurr nameless bastardy
thou author obloquy
shalt thy trespass cited rhymes
sung children succeeding times

thou yield rest thy secret friend
fault unknown thought unacted
little harm done great good end
lawful policy remains enacted
poisonous simple sometimes compacted
pure compound applied
venom effect purified

thy husband thy children sake
tender suit bequeath lot
shame device take
blemish never forgot
worse slavish wipe birth hour blot
marks descried men nativity
nature faults infamy

cockatrice dead killing eye
rouseth makes pause
picture pure piety
like white hind grype sharp claws
pleads wilderness laws
rough beast knows gentle right
aught obeys foul appetite

black fac cloud world doth threat
dim mist aspiring mountains hiding
earth dark womb gentle gust doth get
blows pitchy vapours biding
hindering present fall dividing
unhallow haste words delays
moody pluto winks orpheus plays

yet foul night working cat doth dally
hold fast foot weak mouse panteth
sad behaviour feeds vulture folly
swallowing gulf even plenty wanteth
ear prayers admits heart granteth
penetrable entrance plaining
tears harden lust though marble wear raining

pity pleading eyes sadly fix
remorseless wrinkles face
modest eloquence sighs mix
oratory adds grace
puts period often place
midst sentence accent breaks
twice doth begin ere speaks

conjures high almighty jove
knighthood gentry sweet friendship oath
untimely tears husband love
holy human law common troth
heaven earth power
borrow bed make retire
stoop honour foul desire

quoth reward hospitality
black payment thou hast pretended
mud fountain gave drink thee
mar thing amended
end thy ill aim shoot ended
woodman doth bend bow
strike poor unseasonable doe

husband thy friend sake spare
thyself art mighty thine sake leave
weakling ensnare
thou look st like deceit deceive
sighs like whirlwinds labour hence heave thee
ever man mov woman moans
moved tears sighs groans

together like troubled ocean
beat thy rocky wreck threatening heart
soften continual motion
stones dissolv water convert
harder stone thou art
melt tears compassionate
soft pity enters iron gate

tarquin likeness entertain thee
hast thou put shape shame
host heaven complain
thou wrong st honour wound st princely name
thou art thou seem st
thou seem st thou art god king
kings like gods govern every thing

thy shame seeded thine age
thus thy vices bud thy spring
thy hope thou dar st outrage
dar st thou thou art king
remember outrageous thing
vassal actors wip away
kings misdeeds hid clay

deed make thee lov fear
happy monarchs still fear love
foul offenders thou perforce must bear
thee like offences prove
fear thy remove
princes glass school book
subjects eyes learn read look

wilt thou school lust shall learn
must thee read lectures shame
wilt thou glass wherein shall discern
authority sin warrant blame
privilege dishonour thy name
thou back st reproach long living laud
mak st fair reputation bawd

hast thou command gave thee
pure heart command thy rebel
draw thy sword guard iniquity
lent thee brood kill
thy princely office canst thou fulfill
pattern thy fault foul sin may say
learn sin thou didst teach way

think vile spectacle
view thy present trespass another
men faults seldom appear
transgressions partially smother
guilt would seem death worthy thy brother
wrapp infamies
misdeeds askaunce eyes

thee thee heav hands appeal
seducing lust thy rash relier
sue exil majesty repeal
let return flattering thoughts retire
true respect prison false desire
wipe dim mist thy doting eyne
thou shalt see thy state pity mine

done quoth uncontrolled tide
turns swells higher let
small lights soon blown huge fires abide
wind greater fury fret
petty streams pay daily debt
salt sovereign fresh falls haste
add flow alter taste

thou art quoth sea sovereign king
lo falls thy boundless flood
black lust dishonour shame misgoverning
seek stain ocean thy blood
petty ills shall change thy good
thy sea within puddle womb hears
puddle thy sea dispers

shall slaves king thou slave
thou nobly base basely dignified
thou fair life thy fouler grave
thou loathed shame thy pride
lesser thing greater hide
cedar stoops base shrub foot
low shrubs whither cedar root

let thy thoughts low vassals thy state
quoth heaven hear thee
yield love enforced hate
instead love coy touch shall rudely tear thee
done despitefully mean bear thee
unto base bed rascal groom
thy partner shameful doom

said sets foot upon light
light lust deadly enemies
shame folded blind concealing night
unseen doth tyrannize
wolf hath seiz prey poor lamb cries
till white fleece voice controll
entombs outcry lips sweet fold

nightly linen wears
pens piteous clamours head
cooling hot face chastest tears
ever modest eyes sorrow shed
prone lust stain pure bed
spots whereof could weeping purify
tears drop perpetually

hath would lose

lust thief far poorer

burthen guilty mind

like wearied lamb lies panting

unseen secrecy night

time doth weary time complaining
looks night longs morrow
thinks long remaining
short time seems long sorrow sharp sustaining
though woe heavy yet seldom sleeps

painted images hath spent

deep surmise others detriment
losing woes shows discontent
easeth though none ever cur
think dolour others endur

brings home lord company
finds lucrece clad mourning black
round tear distained eye

foretell new storms already spent

met far home wondering chance

last takes bloodless hand
thus begins uncouth ill event
hath thee befall n thou dost trembling stand
sweet love spite hath thy fair colour spent
art thou thus attir discontent
unmask dear dear moody heaviness
tell thy grief may give redress

three times sighs gives sorrow fire
ere discharge one word woe
length address answer desire
modestly prepares let know

pale swan watery nest

tell one poor tired tongue

task hath say
dear husband interest thy bed
stranger came pillow lay
thou wast wont rest thy weary head
wrong else may imagined
foul enforcement might done
alas thy lucrece free

dreadful dead dark midnight
shining falchion chamber came
creeping creature flaming light
softly cried awake thou roman dame
entertain love else lasting shame
thee thine night inflict
thou love desire contradict

hard favour groom thine quoth
unless thou yoke thy liking
murder straight slaughter thee

lechers deed act
fame thy perpetual infamy

begin start cry
heart sets sword
swearing unless took patiently
live speak another word
shame still rest upon record
never forgot mighty rome
adulterate death lucrece groom

mine enemy strong poor self weak
far weaker strong fear
bloody judge forbade tongue speak
rightful plea might plead justice
scarlet lust came evidence swear
poor beauty purloin eyes

venus adonis

even sun purple colour face
ta en last leave weeping morn
rose cheek adonis tried chase
hunting lov love laugh scorn
sick thoughted venus makes amain unto
like bold fac suitor gins woo

thrice fairer thus began
field chief flower sweet compare
stain nymphs lovely man
white red doves roses
nature made thee strife
saith world hath ending thy life

vouchsafe thou wonder alight thy steed
rein proud head saddle bow
thou wilt deign favour thy meed
thousand honey secrets shalt thou know
come sit never serpent hisses
set smother thee kisses

yet cloy thy lips loath satiety
rather famish amid plenty
making red pale fresh variety
ten kisses short one one long twenty
summer day seem hour short
wasted time beguiling sport

seizeth sweating palm
precedent pith livelihood
trembling passion calls balm
earth sovereign salve goddess good
enrag desire doth lend force
courageously pluck horse

one arm lusty courser rein
tender boy
blush pouted dull disdain
leaden appetite unapt toy
red hot coals glowing fire
red shame frosty desire

studded bridle ragged bough
nimbly fastens quick love
steed stalled even
tie rider begins prove
backward push would thrust
govern strength though lust

soon along
leaning elbows hips
doth stroke cheek doth frown
gins chide soon stops lips
kissing speaks lustful language broken
thou wilt chide thy lips shall never open

burns bashful shame tears
doth quench maiden burning cheeks
windy sighs golden hairs
fan blow dry seeks
saith immodest blames miss
follows murders kiss

even empty eagle sharp fast
tires beak feathers flesh bone
shaking wings devouring haste
till either gorge stuff prey gone
even kiss brow cheek chin
ends doth anew begin

forc content never obey
panting lies breatheth face
feedeth steam prey
calls heavenly moisture air grace
wishing cheeks gardens full flowers
dew distilling showers

look bird lies tangled net
fasten arms adonis lies
pure shame aw resistance made fret
bred beauty angry eyes
rain added river rank
perforce force overflow bank

still entreats prettily entreats
pretty ear tunes tale
still sullen still lours frets
twixt crimson shame anger ashy pale
red loves best white
best better delight

look choose love
fair immortal hand swears
soft bosom never remove
till take truce contending tears
long rain making cheeks wet
one sweet kiss shall pay countless debt

upon promise raise chin
like dive dapper peering wave
look ducks quickly
offers give crave
lips ready pay
winks turns lips another way

never passenger summer heat
thirst drink good turn
help sees help get
bathes water yet fire must burn
pity gan cry flint hearted boy
tis kiss beg art thou coy

woo entreat thee
even stern direful god war
whose sinewy neck battle ne er bow
conquers comes every jar
yet hath captive slave
begg thou unask shalt

altars hath hung lance
batter shield uncontrolled crest
sake hath learn sport dance
toy wanton dally smile jest
scorning churlish drum ensign red
making arms field tent bed

thus overrul oversway
leading prisoner red rose chain
strong temper steel stronger strength obey
yet servile coy disdain
oh proud brag thy might
mast ring foil god fight

touch lips fair lips thine
though mine fair yet red
kiss shall thine well mine
see st thou ground hold thy head
look mine eyeballs thy beauty lies
lips lips since eyes eyes

art thou asham kiss wink
wink shall day seem night
love keeps revels twain
bold play sport sight
blue vein violets whereon lean
never blab know mean

tender spring upon thy tempting lip
shows thee unripe yet mayst thou well tasted
make use time let advantage slip
beauty within wasted
fair flowers gather prime
rot consume little time

hard favour foul wrinkled old
ill nurtur crooked churlish harsh voice
erworn despised rheumatic cold
thick sighted barren lean lacking juice
mightst thou pause thee
defects dost abhor

thou canst see one wrinkle brow
mine eyes grey bright quick turning
beauty spring doth yearly grow
flesh soft plump marrow burning
smooth moist hand thy hand felt
would thy palm dissolve seem melt

bid discourse enchant thine ear
like fairy trip upon green
like nymph long dishevell hair
dance sands yet footing seen
love spirit compact fire
gross sink light aspire

witness primrose bank whereon lie
forceless flowers like sturdy trees support
two strengthless doves draw sky
morn till night even list sport
love light sweet boy may
thou shouldst think heavy unto thee

thine heart thine face affected
thy right hand seize love upon thy left
woo thyself thyself rejected
steal thine freedom complain theft
narcissus forsook
died kiss shadow brook

torches made light jewels wear
dainties taste fresh beauty use
herbs smell sappy plants bear
things growing growth abuse
seeds spring seeds beauty breedeth beauty
thou wast begot get thy duty

upon earth increase shouldst thou feed
unless earth thy increase fed
law nature thou art bound breed
thine may live thou thyself art dead
spite death thou dost survive
thy likeness still left alive

love sick queen began sweat
lay shadow forsook
titan tired midday heat
burning eye hotly overlook
wishing adonis team guide
like venus side

adonis lazy spright
heavy dark disliking eye
louring brows erwhelming fair sight
like misty vapours blot sky
souring cheeks cries fie love
sun doth burn face must remove

ay quoth venus young unkind
bare excuses mak st thou gone
sigh celestial breath whose gentle wind
shall cool heat descending sun
make shadow thee hairs
burn quench tears

sun shines heaven shines warm
lo lie sun thee
heat thence doth little harm
thine eye darts forth fire burneth
immortal life done
heavenly earthly sun

art thou obdurate flinty hard steel
nay flint stone rain relenteth
art thou woman son canst feel
tis love want love tormenteth
thy mother borne hard mind
brought forth thee died unkind

thou shouldst contemn
great danger dwells upon suit
thy lips worse one poor kiss
speak fair speak fair words else mute
give one kiss give thee
one int rest thou wilt twain

fie lifeless picture cold senseless stone
well painted idol image dull dead
statue contenting eye alone
thing like man woman bred
thou art man though man complexion
men kiss even direction

said impatience chokes pleading tongue
swelling passion doth provoke pause
red cheeks fiery eyes blaze forth wrong
judge love right cause
weeps fain would speak
sobs intendments break

sometimes shakes head hand
gazeth ground
sometimes arms infold like band
would arms bound
thence struggles gone
locks lily fingers one one

within circuit ivory pale
park thou shalt deer
feed thou wilt mountain dale
graze lips hills dry
stray lower pleasant fountains lie

sweet bottom grass high delightful plain
round rising hillocks brakes obscure rough

dog shall rouse thee though thousand bark

cheek appears pretty dimple

might buried tomb simple

love liv could die

poor queen love thine law forlorn
love cheek smiles thee scorn

words done woes increasing
time spent object away

pity cries favour remorse
away springs hasteth horse

lo forth copse neighbours
breeding jennet lusty young proud
adonis tramping courser doth espy
forth rushes snorts neighs aloud
strong neck steed tied unto tree
breaketh rein straight goes

woven girths breaks asunder
bearing earth hard hoof wounds
whose hollow womb resounds like heaven thunder
iron bit crusheth tween teeth
controlling controlled

upon compass crest stand end

furnace vapours doth send

shows hot courage high desire

gentle majesty modest pride

captivate eye
fair breeder standing

nothing else proud sight agrees

art nature workmanship strife
dead living exceed

shape courage colour pace bone

though nothing body bane would cure thee

tis fault bereft

mind thought busy care
get palfrey mare

thus replies thy palfrey
welcomes warm approach sweet desire

else suffer set heart fire
sea hath bounds deep desire hath none
therefore marvel though thy horse gone

throwing base thong bending crest

though dumb yet proceedings teach thee

made perfect never lost

unless boar chase
tis much borrow owe

laughs weeps breath

loseth pride never waxeth strong

heart hard make batt ry

would thou hadst hearing
thy mermaid voice hath done double wrong
load press bearing

doth call affection sentinel

one sore sick hears passing bell

turn return indenting way

unlike thou hear st moralize

thou fall oh imagine
earth love thee thy footing trips
rob thee kiss
rich preys make true men thieves thy lips
make modest dian cloudy forlorn

dark night perceive reason
cynthia shame obscures silver shine
till forging nature condemn treason
stealing moulds heaven divine
wherein fram thee high heaven despite
shame sun day night

therefore hath brib destinies
cross curious workmanship nature
mingle beauty infirmities
pure perfection impure defeature
making subject tyranny
mad mischances much misery

burning fevers agues pale faint
life poisoning pestilence frenzies wood
marrow eating sickness whose attaint
disorder breeds heating blood
surfeits imposthumes grief damn despair
swear nature death framing thee fair

least maladies
one minute fight brings beauty
favour savour hue qualities
whereat th impartial gazer late wonder
sudden wasted thaw done
mountain snow melts midday sun

therefore despite fruitless chastity
love lacking vestals self loving nuns
earth would breed scarcity
barren dearth daughters sons
prodigal lamp burns night
dries oil lend world light

thy body swallowing grave
seeming bury posterity
rights time thou needs must
thou destroy dark obscurity
world hold thee disdain
sith thy pride fair hope slain

thyself thyself art made away
mischief worse civil home bred strife
whose desperate hands slay
butcher sire reeves son life
foul cank ring rust hidden treasure frets
gold put use gold begets

nay quoth adon fall
idle handled theme
kiss gave bestow vain
vain strive stream
black fac night desire foul nurse
treatise makes like worse worse

love lent twenty thousand tongues
every tongue moving
bewitching like wanton mermaid songs
yet mine ear tempting tune blown
know heart stands armed mine ear
let false sound enter

lest deceiving harmony run
quiet closure breast
little heart quite undone
bedchamber barr rest
lady heart longs groan
soundly sleeps sleeps alone

urg reprove
path smooth leadeth danger
hate love device love
lends embracements unto every stranger
increase strange excuse
reason bawd lust abuse

call love love heaven fled
since sweating lust earth usurp name
whose simple semblance hath fed
upon fresh beauty blotting blame
hot tyrant stains soon bereaves
caterpillars tender leaves

love comforteth like sunshine rain
lust effect tempest sun
love gentle spring doth always fresh remain
lust winter comes ere summer half done
love surfeits lust like glutton dies
love truth lust full forged lies

could tell dare say
text old orator green
therefore sadness away
face full shame heart teen
mine ears wanton talk attended
burn offended

breaketh sweet embrace
fair arms bound breast
homeward dark laund runs apace
leaves love upon back deeply distress
look bright star shooteth sky
glides night venus eye

darts one shore
gazing upon late embarked friend
till wild waves seen
whose ridges meeting clouds contend
merciless pitchy night
fold object feed sight

whereat amaz one unaware
hath dropp precious jewel flood
stonish night wanderers often
light blown mistrustful wood
even confounded dark lay
lost fair discovery way

beats heart whereat groans
neighbour caves seeming troubled
make verbal repetition moans
passion passion deeply redoubled
ay cries twenty times woe woe
twenty echoes twenty times cry

marking begins wailing note
sings extemporally woeful ditty
love makes young men thrall old men dote
love wise folly foolish witty
heavy anthem still concludes woe
still choir echoes answer

song tedious outwore night
lovers hours long though seeming short
pleas others think delight
like circumstance like sport
copious stories oftentimes begun
end without audience never done

hath spend night withal
idle sounds resembling parasites
like shrill tongu tapsters answering every call
soothing humour fantastic wits
says tis answer tis
would say said

lo gentle lark weary rest
moist cabinet mounts high
wakes morning whose silver breast
sun ariseth majesty
doth world gloriously behold
cedar tops hills seem burnish gold

venus salutes fair good morrow
oh thou clear god patron light
lamp shining star doth borrow
beauteous influence makes bright
lives son suck earthly mother
may lend thee light thou dost lend

said hasteth myrtle grove
musing morning much erworn
yet hears tidings love
hearkens hounds horn
anon hears chant lustily
haste coasteth cry

runs bushes way
catch neck kiss face
twine thigh make stay
wildly breaketh strict embrace
like milch doe whose swelling dugs ache
hasting feed fawn hid brake

hears hounds bay
whereat starts like one spies adder
wreath fatal folds way
fear whereof doth make shake shudder
even timorous yelping hounds
appals senses spirit confounds

knows gentle chase
blunt boar rough bear lion proud
cry remaineth one place
fearfully dogs exclaim aloud
finding enemy curst
strain court sy shall cope first

dismal cry rings sadly ear
enters surprise heart
overcome doubt bloodless fear
cold pale weakness numbs feeling part
like soldiers captain doth yield
basely fly dare stay field

thus stands trembling ecstasy
till cheering senses sore dismay
tells tis causeless fantasy
childish error afraid
bids leave quaking bids fear
word spied hunted boar

whose frothy mouth bepainted red
like milk blood mingled together
second fear sinews spread
madly hurries knows whither
way runs
back retires rate boar murther

thousand spleens bear thousand ways
treads path untreads
haste mated delays
like proceedings drunken brain
full respects yet naught respecting
hand things naught effecting

kennel brake finds hound
asks weary caitiff master
another licking wound
gainst venom sores sovereign plaster
meets another sadly scowling
speaks replies howling

hath ceas ill resounding noise
another flap mouth mourner black grim
welkin volleys voice
another another answer
clapping proud tails ground
shaking scratch ears bleeding go

look world poor people amazed
apparitions signs prodigies
whereon fearful eyes long gazed
infusing dreadful prophecies
sad sighs draws breath
sighing exclaims death

hard favour tyrant ugly meagre lean
hateful divorce love thus chides death
grim grinning ghost earth worm dost thou mean
stifle beauty steal breath
liv breath beauty set
gloss rose smell violet

dead
seeing beauty thou shouldst strike
yes may thou hast eyes see
hatefully random dost thou hit
thy mark feeble age thy false dart
mistakes aim cleaves infant heart

hadst thou bid beware spoke
hearing thy power lost power
destinies curse thee stroke
bid thee crop weed thou pluck st flower
love golden arrow fled
death ebon dart strike dead

dost thou drink tears thou provok st weeping
may heavy groan advantage thee
hast thou cast eternal sleeping
eyes taught eyes see
nature cares thy mortal vigour
since best work ruin thy rigour

overcome one full despair
vail eyelids like sluices stopp
crystal tide two cheeks fair
sweet channel bosom dropp
flood gates breaks silver rain
strong course opens

eyes tears lend borrow
eyes seen tears tears eye
crystals view sorrow
sorrow friendly sighs sought still dry
like stormy day wind rain
sighs dry cheeks tears make wet

variable passions throng constant woe
striving best become grief
entertain passion labours
every present sorrow seemeth chief
none best join together
like many clouds consulting foul weather

far hears huntsman holla
nurse song ne er pleas babe well
dire imagination follow
sound hope doth labour expel
reviving joy bids rejoice
flatters adonis voice

whereat tears began turn tide
prison eye like pearls glass
yet sometimes falls orient drop beside
cheek melts scorning pass
wash foul face sluttish ground
drunken seemeth drown

hard believing love strange seems
believe yet credulous
thy weal woe extremes
despair hope make thee ridiculous
one doth flatter thee thoughts unlikely
likely thoughts kills thee quickly

unweaves web hath wrought
adonis lives death blame
call naught
adds honours hateful name
clepes king graves grave kings
imperious supreme mortal things

quoth sweet death jest
yet pardon felt kind fear
whenas met boar bloody beast
knows pity still severe
gentle shadow truth must confess
rail thee fearing love decease

tis fault boar provok tongue
wreak invisible commander
tis foul creature hath done thee wrong
act author slander
grief hath two tongues never woman yet
could rule without ten women wit

thus hoping adonis alive
rash suspect doth extenuate
beauty may better thrive
death humbly doth insinuate
tells trophies statues tombs stories
victories triumphs glories

love quoth much fool
weak silly mind
wail death lives must die
till mutual overthrow mortal kind
dead beauty slain
beauty dead black chaos comes

fie fie fond love thou art full fear
one treasure laden hemm thieves
trifles unwitnessed eye ear
thy coward heart false bethinking grieves
even word hears merry horn
whereat leaps late forlorn

falcon lure away flies
grass stoops treads light
haste unfortunately spies
foul boar conquest fair delight
seen eyes murder view
like stars asham day withdrew

snail whose tender horns hit
shrinks backwards shelly cave pain
smother shade doth sit
long fearing creep forth
bloody view eyes fled
deep dark cabins head

resign office light
disposing troubled brain
bids still consort ugly night
never wound heart looks
like king perplexed throne
suggestion gives deadly groan

whereat tributary subject quakes
wind imprison ground
struggling passage earth foundation shakes
cold terror doth men minds confound
mutiny part doth surprise
dark beds leap eyes

open threw unwilling light
upon wide wound boar trench
soft flank whose wonted lily white
purple tears wound wept drench
flower nigh grass herb leaf weed
stole blood seem bleed

solemn sympathy poor venus noteth
one shoulder doth hang head
dumbly passions franticly doteth
thinks could die dead
voice stopp joints forget bow
eyes mad wept till

upon hurt looks steadfastly
sight dazzling makes wound seem three
reprehends mangling eye
makes gashes breach
face seems twain several limb doubled
oft eye mistakes brain troubled

tongue express grief one
yet quoth behold two adons dead
sighs blown away salt tears gone
mine eyes turn fire heart lead
heavy heart lead melt mine eyes red fire
shall die drops hot desire

alas poor world treasure hast thou lost
face remains alive worth viewing
whose tongue music canst thou boast
things long since anything ensuing
flowers sweet colours fresh trim
true sweet beauty liv died

bonnet veil henceforth creature wear
sun wind ever strive kiss
fair lose need fear
sun doth scorn wind doth hiss
adonis liv sun sharp air
lurk like two thieves rob fair

therefore would put bonnet
whose brim gaudy sun would peep
wind would blow gone
play locks would adonis weep
straight pity tender years
would strive first dry tears

see face lion walk along
behind hedge would fear
recreate hath sung
tiger would tame gently hear
spoke wolf would leave prey
never fright silly lamb day

beheld shadow brook
fishes spread golden gills
birds pleasure took
would sing bills
would bring mulberries ripe red cherries
fed sight berries

foul grim urchin snouted boar
whose downward eye still looketh grave
ne er saw beauteous livery wore
witness entertainment gave
see face know
thought kiss hath kill

tis true tis true thus adonis slain
ran upon boar sharp spear
whet teeth
kiss thought persuade
nuzzling flank loving swine
sheath unaware tusk soft groin

tooth like must confess
kissing kill first
dead never bless
youth accurst
falleth place stood
stains face congealed blood

looks upon lips pale
takes hand cold
whispers ears heavy tale
heard woeful words told
lifts coffer lids close eyes
lo two lamps burnt darkness lies

two glasses beheld
thousand times reflect
virtue lost wherein late excell
every beauty robb effect
wonder time quoth spite
thou dead day yet light

since thou art dead lo prophesy
sorrow love hereafter shall attend
shall waited jealousy
find sweet beginning unsavoury end
ne er settled equally high low
love pleasure shall match woe

shall fickle false full fraud
bud blasted breathing
bottom poison top erstraw
sweets shall truest sight beguile
strongest body shall make weak
strike wise dumb teach fool speak

shall sparing full riot
teaching decrepit age tread measures
staring ruffian shall keep quiet
pluck rich enrich poor treasures
shall raging mad silly mild
make young old old become child

shall suspect cause fear
shall fear mistrust
shall merciful severe
deceiving seems
perverse shall shows toward
put fear valour courage coward

shall cause war dire events
set dissension twixt son sire
subject servile discontents
dry combustious matter fire
sith prime death doth love destroy
love best love shall enjoy

boy side lay kill
melted like vapour sight
blood ground lay spill
purple flower sprung chequer white
resembling well pale cheeks blood
round drops upon whiteness stood

bows head new sprung flower smell
comparing adonis breath
says within bosom shall dwell
since reft death
drops stalk breach appears
green dropping sap compares tears

poor flower quoth thy father guise
sweet issue sweet smelling sire
every little grief wet eyes
grow unto desire
tis thine know good
wither breast blood

thy father bed breast
thou art next blood tis thy right
lo hollow cradle take thy rest
throbbing heart shall rock thee day night
shall one minute hour
wherein kiss sweet love flower

thus weary world away hies
yokes silver doves whose swift aid
mistress mounted empty skies
light chariot quickly convey
holding course paphos queen
means immure seen
